2297.name: Axe Flinger
2297.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, deal 2 damage to the enemy hero.
2297.flavor: Once a lowly "Stick Flinger", he's been relentless on the path to his ultimate dream: "Tauren Flinger".
2297.howToGet: Unlocked in Molten Core, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2297.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Molten Core, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.

38843.name: Stand Against Darkness
38843.flavor: Or if you're too tired, you can just kind of lean against the darkness.

1802.name: Poison Seeds
1802.text: Destroy all minions and summon 2/2 Treants to replace them.
1802.flavor: "Poisonseed Bagel" is the least popular bagel at McTiggin's Druidic Bagel Emporium.
1802.howToGet: Unlocked in The Arachnid Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1802.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in The Arachnid Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.

38898.name: Usher of Souls
38898.text: Whenever a friendly minion dies, give your C'Thun +1/+1 (wherever it is).
38898.flavor: Nothing unburdens your soul like a good ushing!

2172.name: Mistress of Pain
2172.text: Whenever this minion deals damage, restore that much Health to your hero.
2172.flavor: Her sister is the Mistress of Pane who sells windows and shower doors.

2069.name: Scarlet Purifier
2069.text: Battlecry: Deal 2 damage to all minions with Deathrattle.
2069.flavor: The Scarlet Crusade is doing market research to find out if the "Mauve Crusade" would be better received.

1940.name: Mechwarper
1940.flavor: Mechs that summon mechs? What's next? Donuts that summon donuts? Mmmmm.

39712.name: Maelstrom Portal
39712.flavor: They bill this as a popular resort attraction, but they try and get your money up front.
39712.howToGet: Unlocked in the Parlor, in One Night in Karazhan.
39712.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Parlor, in One Night in Karazhan.

39715.name: Firelands Portal
39715.text:
Deal $5 damage. Summon a random
5-Cost minion.
39715.flavor: Come to beautiful Firelands! Where it's "Way nicer than the Abyssal Maw!"
39715.howToGet: Unlocked in the Prologue, in One Night in Karazhan.
39715.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Prologue, in One Night in Karazhan.

39714.name: Moonglade Portal
39714.text:
Restore 6 Health. Summon a random
6-Cost minion.
39714.flavor: Ain't no party like a Moonglade party ‘cause a Moonglade party got bears.
39714.howToGet: Unlocked in the Spire, in One Night in Karazhan.
39714.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Spire, in One Night in Karazhan.

39716.name: Silvermoon Portal
39716.text:
Give a minion +2/+2. Summon a random
2-Cost minion.
39716.flavor: What's Millhouse Manastorm doing in Silvermoon?
39716.howToGet: Unlocked in the Opera, in One Night in Karazhan.
39716.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Opera, in One Night in Karazhan.

818.name: Far Sight
818.text: Draw a card. That card costs (3) less.
818.flavor: Drek'thar can't see, but he can see. You know what I mean? It's ok if you don't.

345.name: Assassinate
345.flavor: If you don't want to be assassinated, move to the Barrens and change your name. Good luck!

810.name: Gorehowl
810.text: Attacking a minion costs 1 Attack instead of 1 Durability.
810.flavor: Grommash Hellscream's famous axe.  Somehow this ended up in Prince Malchezaar's possession.  Quite the mystery!

811.name: Cult Master
811.text: Whenever one of your other minions dies, draw a card.
811.flavor: She may be an evil cult master, but she still calls her parents once a week.

348.name: Dark Iron Dwarf
348.text: Battlecry: Give a minion +2 Attack this turn.
348.flavor: Guardians of Dark Iron Ore.  Perhaps the most annoying ore, given where you have to forge it.

38897.name: Ancient Shieldbearer
38897.text: Battlecry: If your C'Thun has at least 10 Attack, gain 10 Armor.
38897.flavor: Back in her day, each shield weighed two tons and she had to carry four of them on each arm!

2910.name: Naga Sea Witch
2910.flavor: If she had studied harder, she would have been a C+ witch.
2910.howToGet: Unlocked in The Ruined City, in the League of Explorers adventure.
2910.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in The Ruined City, in the League of Explorers adventure.

2911.name: Gorillabot A-3
2911.text: Battlecry: If you control another Mech, Discover a Mech.
2911.flavor: A-1 and A-2 went nuts, when they should have gone bolts.
2911.howToGet: Unlocked in The Ruined City, in the League of Explorers adventure.
2911.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in The Ruined City, in the League of Explorers adventure.

1799.name: Wailing Soul
1799.flavor: This soul just wails on you. Dang, soul, let up already.
1799.howToGet: Unlocked in The Construct Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1799.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in The Construct Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.

38957.name: Midnight Drake
38957.text: Battlecry: Gain +1 Attack for each other card in your hand.

1990.name: One-eyed Cheat
1990.text: Whenever you summon a Pirate, gain Stealth.
1990.flavor: When pirates say there is no "Eye" in "team," they are very literal about it.

2918.name: Huge Toad
2918.text: Deathrattle: Deal 1 damage to a random enemy.
2918.howToGet: Unlocked in The Ruined City, in the League of Explorers adventure.
2918.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in The Ruined City, in the League of Explorers adventure.

2919.name: Tomb Spider
2919.flavor: Less serious than its cousin, the Grave Spider.
2919.howToGet: Unlocked in Uldaman, in the League of Explorers adventure.
2919.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Uldaman, in the League of Explorers adventure.

715.name: Mana Wraith
715.flavor: They come out at night to eat leftover mana crystals. "Mmmmmm," they say.

1790.name: Deathlord
1790.text: Taunt. Deathrattle: Your opponent puts a minion from their deck into the battlefield.
1790.howToGet: Unlocked in The Military Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1790.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in The Military Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.

1797.name: Feugen
1797.text: Deathrattle: If Stalagg also died this game, summon Thaddius.
1797.flavor: Feugen is sad because everyone likes Stalagg better.
1797.howToGet: Unlocked in The Construct Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1797.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in The Construct Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.

1796.name: Stalagg
1796.text: Deathrattle: If Feugen also died this game, summon Thaddius.
1796.flavor: Stalagg want to write own flavor text.  "STALAGG AWESOME!"
1796.howToGet: Unlocked in The Construct Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1796.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in The Construct Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.

1794.name: Kel'Thuzad
1794.text: At the end of each turn, summon all friendly minions that died this turn.
1794.flavor: Kel'Thuzad could not resist the call of the Lich King. Even when it's just a robo-call extolling the Lich King's virtues.
1794.howToGet: Unlocked in Frostwyrm Lair, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1794.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Frostwyrm Lair, in the Naxxramas adventure.

39481.name: Kindly Grandmother
39481.howToGet: Unlocked in the Opera, in One Night in Karazhan.
39481.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Opera, in One Night in Karazhan.

914.name: Shadow Bolt
914.flavor: It’s a Bolt.   It's made out of Shadow.   What more do you need to know!

1068.name: Guardian of Kings
1068.flavor: Holy beings from the beyond are so cliché!

1997.name: Fel Cannon
1997.text: At the end of your turn, deal 2 damage to a non-Mech minion.
1997.flavor: The box says, "New and improved, with 200% more fel!"

1063.name: Murloc Warleader
1063.flavor: Do Murlocs ever get tired of making the same old sound?  Nope!  Mrglglrglglglglglglgl!

1064.name: Blade Flurry
1064.text: Destroy your weapon and deal its damage to all enemy minions.
1064.flavor: "Look, it's not just about waving daggers around really fast.  It's a lot more complicated than that." - Shan, Rogue Trainer

2076.name: Recombobulator
2076.text: Battlecry: Transform a friendly minion into a random minion with the same Cost.
2076.flavor: For when you didn’t combobulate quite right the first time around.

299.name: Forked Lightning
299.text: Deal $2 damage to 2 random enemy minions. Overload: (2)
299.flavor: If you combine it with Spooned Lightning and Knived Lightning, you have the full dining set.

296.name: Kill Command
296.text: Deal $3 damage. If you have a Beast, deal $5 damage instead.

2074.name: Junkbot
2074.text: Whenever a friendly Mech dies, gain +2/+2.
2074.flavor: One bot's junk is another bot's AWESOME UPGRADE!

292.name: Multi-Shot
292.text: Deal $3 damage to two random enemy minions.

1662.name: Eaglehorn Bow
1662.text: Whenever a friendly Secret is revealed, gain +1 Durability.
1662.flavor: First Lesson: Put the pointy end in the other guy.

290.name: Ironbeak Owl
290.flavor: Their wings are silent but their screech is... whatever the opposite of silent is.

291.name: Holy Light
291.flavor: If you are often bathed in Holy Light, you should consider wearing sunscreen.

1087.name: Pyroblast
1087.flavor: Take the time for an evil laugh after you draw this card.

2288.name: Imp Gang Boss
2288.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, summon a 1/1 Imp.
2288.flavor: His imp gang likes to sneak into Stormwind to spraypaint "Ragnaros Rulez" on the Mage Tower.
2288.howToGet: Unlocked in Molten Core, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2288.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Molten Core, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.

1084.name: Mirror Image
1084.flavor: Oh hey it's Mirror Image! !egamI rorriM s'ti yeh hO

596.name: Armorsmith
596.text: Whenever a friendly minion takes damage, gain 1 Armor.
596.flavor: She accepts guild funds for repairs!

195.name: Mirror Entity
195.text: Secret: After your opponent plays a minion, summon a copy of it.
195.flavor: "You go first." - Krush'gor the Behemoth, to his pet boar.

1122.name: Venture Co. Mercenary
1122.flavor: No Job is too big.  No fee is too big.

196.name: Vanish
196.text: Return all minions to their owner's hand.

191.name: Murloc Raider
191.flavor: Mrrraggglhlhghghlgh, mrgaaag blarrghlgaahahl mrgggg glhalhah a bghhll graggmgmg Garrosh mglhlhlh mrghlhlhl!!

192.name: Ice Block
192.text: Secret: When your hero takes fatal damage, prevent it and become Immune this turn.
192.flavor: Ice is nice, and will suffice!

272.name: Cabal Shadow Priest
272.text: Battlecry: Take control of an enemy minion that has 2 or less Attack.
272.flavor: You never know who may be secretly working for the Cabal....

279.name: Holy Smite
279.flavor: It doesn't matter how pious you are.  Everyone needs a good smiting now and again.

38913.name: A Light in the Darkness
38913.flavor: Wait, how can you have a light in the dark?  If you turn on a light while it’s dark, doesn’t that mean it’s no longer dark?

2822.name: Dreadsteed
2822.flavor: Crescendo himself summoned this steed, riding it to victory in the Grand Tournament.  Wherever he rides, an army of riders ride behind him, supporting the legendary champion.

2542.name: Polymorph: Boar
2542.text: Transform a minion into a 4/2 Boar with Charge.

2541.name: Effigy
2541.text: Secret: When a friendly minion dies, summon a random minion with the same Cost.

2546.name: Rhonin
2546.text: Deathrattle: Add 3 copies of Arcane Missiles to your hand.

2545.name: Fallen Hero
2545.text: Your Hero Power deals 1 extra damage.

344.name: Charge
344.text: Give a friendly minion +2 Attack and Charge.
344.flavor: "Guys! Guys! Slow down!" - some kind of non-warrior minion

2549.name: Dalaran Aspirant
2549.flavor: Is he aspiring or inspiring?  Make up your mind!

2280.name: Chromaggus
2280.text: Whenever you draw a card, put another copy into your hand.
2280.flavor: Left head and right head can never agree about what to eat for dinner, so they always end up just eating ramen again.
2280.howToGet: Unlocked in Blackwing Lair, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2280.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Blackwing Lair, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.

526.name: Gruul
526.text: At the end of each turn, gain +1/+1 .
526.flavor: He's Gruul "the Dragonkiller".  He just wanted to cuddle them… he never meant to…

1019.name: Dread Infernal
1019.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage to ALL other characters.
1019.flavor: "INFERNOOOOOOOOOO!" - Jaraxxus, Eredar Lord of the Burning Legion

523.name: Dragonling Mechanic
523.flavor: She is still working on installing the rocket launcher add-on for Mr. Bitey.

1014.name: Wild Pyromancer
1014.text: After you cast a spell, deal 1 damage to ALL minions.
1014.flavor: BOOM BABY BOOM!  BAD IS GOOD!  DOWN WITH GOVERNMENT!

2263.name: Core Rager
2263.text: Battlecry: If your hand is empty, gain +3/+3.
2263.flavor: It takes a special kind of hunter to venture deep into a firey lava pit and convince a monster who lives there to come home and be a cuddly housepet.
2263.howToGet: Unlocked in Blackrock Spire, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2263.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Blackrock Spire, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.

1016.name: Coldlight Oracle
1016.flavor: They can see the future.   In that future both players draw more cards.   Spoooky.

2261.name: Nefarian
2261.text: Battlecry: Add 2 random spells to your hand (from your opponent's class).
2261.flavor: They call him "Blackwing" because he's a black dragon...... and he's got wings.
2261.howToGet: Unlocked in Hidden Laboratory, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2261.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Hidden Laboratory, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.

39841.name: Medivh, the Guardian
39841.text: Battlecry: Equip Atiesh, Greatstaff of the Guardian.
39841.flavor: If you think the party's great now, just wait 'til he invites the orcs over!
39841.howToGet: Unlocked in the Spire, in One Night in Karazhan.
39841.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Spire, in One Night in Karazhan.

39840.name: Prince Malchezaar
39840.text: [x]When the game starts, add 5 extra Legendary minions to your deck.
39840.flavor: He was super excited to acquire Gorehowl at a garage sale!  Then super disappointed to find out it was a foam reproduction.
39840.howToGet: Unlocked in the Spire, in One Night in Karazhan.
39840.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Spire, in One Night in Karazhan.

2768.name: Shady Dealer
2768.text: Battlecry: If you have a Pirate, gain +1/+1.
2768.flavor: I have great deal for you... for 4 damage to your face!

38403.name: Xaril, Poisoned Mind
38403.text: Battlecry and Deathrattle: Add a random Toxin card to your hand.
38403.flavor: It's basically your own fault if you go around drinking weird green potions handed out by creepy mantid dudes.

440.name: Abomination
440.flavor: Abominations enjoy Fresh Meat and long walks on the beach.

447.name: Arcane Explosion
447.text: Deal $1 damage to all enemy minions.
447.flavor: This spell is much better than Arcane Implosion.

2766.name: Cutpurse
2766.text: Whenever this minion attacks a hero, add the Coin to your hand.
2766.flavor: He has a giant collection of purses now.  One for every outfit!

1091.name: Misdirection
1091.text: Secret: When a character attacks your hero, instead he attacks another random character.
1091.flavor: Sometimes it's as simple as putting on a fake mustache and pointing at someone else.

38436.name: Darkspeaker
38436.text: Battlecry: Swap stats with a friendly minion.
38436.flavor: People often think that Darkspeaker is the arch nemesis of Lightspeaker, but that title actually belongs to Heavyspeaker.

38434.name: Forbidden Shaping
38434.text: Spend all your Mana. Summon a random minion that costs that much.
38434.flavor: But the minion arrives covered in goo.

38433.name: Shadow Word: Horror
38433.text: Destroy all minions with 2 or less Attack.
38433.flavor: It's more succinct than "Shadow Word: Suck Into Vortex."

306.name: Edwin VanCleef
306.text: Combo: Gain +2/+2 for each card played earlier this turn.
306.flavor: He led the Stonemasons in the reconstruction of Stormwind, and when the nobles refused to pay, he founded the Defias Brotherhood to, well, deconstruct Stormwind.

38825.name: Southsea Squidface
38825.flavor: Quick! Before I drown! Let me sharpen your sword for you.

2007.name: Vitality Totem
2007.text: At the end of your turn, restore 4 Health to your hero.
2007.flavor: You can usually find these at the totemist's market on Saturdays.

38439.name: Embrace the Shadow
38439.text: This turn, your healing effects deal damage instead.
38439.flavor: For when your Auchenai Soulpriests call in sick.

2046.name: Mechanical Yeti
2046.flavor: The yetis of Chillwind Point are a source of both inspiration and savage beatings.

903.name: Bestial Wrath
903.text: Give a friendly Beast +2 Attack and Immune this turn.
903.flavor: The seething wrath is just beneath the surface.  Beneath that is wild abandon, followed by slight annoyance.

2044.name: Explosive Sheep
2044.flavor: How is this supposed to work? Your enemies think, "Hey! Cute sheep!" and run over to cuddle it?

2045.name: Anima Golem
2045.text: At the end of each turn, destroy this minion if it's your only one.
2045.flavor: The Dark Animus is evil and mysterious and huge and unable to write sentences that utilize proper grammar.

2043.name: Ship's Cannon
2043.text: After you summon a Pirate, deal 2 damage to a random enemy.
2043.flavor: If you hear someone yell, "Cannonball!" you're about to get wet. Or crushed.

904.name: Eviscerate
904.flavor: There is a high cost to Eviscerating your opponent:  It takes a long time to get blood stains out of leather armor.

2041.name: Cobra Shot
2041.text: Deal $3 damage to a minion and the enemy hero.
2041.flavor: "Cobra Shot" hurts way, way, way more than "Cobra Cuddle."

32.name: Al'Akir the Windlord
32.flavor: He is the weakest of the four Elemental Lords.  And the other three don't let him forget it.

30.name: Thoughtsteal
30.text: Copy 2 cards from your opponent's deck and put them into your hand.
30.flavor: "What do you get when you cast Thoughtsteal on an Orc?  Nothing!" - Tauren joke

37.name: Pint-Sized Summoner
37.text: The first minion you play each turn costs (1) less.
37.flavor: She's quite jealous of the Gallon-Sized Summoner.

36.name: Cenarius
36.text: Choose One - Give your other minions +2/+2; or Summon two 2/2 Treants with Taunt.
36.flavor: Yes, he's a demigod. No, he doesn't need to wear a shirt.

39313.name: Violet Illusionist
39313.text: During your turn, your hero is Immune.
39313.flavor: She’s much more cheerful after losing the ‘n’ in her name.
39313.howToGet: Unlocked in the Spire, in One Night in Karazhan.
39313.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Spire, in One Night in Karazhan.

34.name: Silvermoon Guardian
34.flavor: The first time they tried to guard Silvermoon against the scourge, it didn’t go so well…

641.name: Young Dragonhawk
641.flavor: They were the inspiration for the championship Taurenball team: The Dragonhawks.

640.name: Hogger
640.text: At the end of your turn, summon a 2/2 Gnoll with Taunt.
640.flavor: Hogger is super powerful. If you kill him, it's because he let you.

643.name: Sword of Justice
643.text: After you summon a minion, give it +1/+1 and this loses 1 Durability.
643.flavor: I dub you Sir Loin of Beef!

642.name: Scarlet Crusader
642.flavor: Never wash your whites with a Scarlet Crusader.

2512.name: Frost Giant
2512.text: Costs (1) less for each time you used your Hero Power this game.
2512.flavor: Don't ask him about the beard.  JUST DON'T.

39492.name: Cloaked Huntress
39492.flavor: She's practically GIVING your secrets away!
39492.howToGet: Unlocked in the Parlor, in One Night in Karazhan.
39492.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Parlor, in One Night in Karazhan.

39491.name: Arcanosmith
39491.flavor: He’s really just a Blacksmith, but he thought the fancy title would bring in more business.
39491.howToGet: Unlocked in the Parlor, in One Night in Karazhan.
39491.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Parlor, in One Night in Karazhan.

38266.name: Evolve
38266.text: Transform your minions into random minions that cost (1) more.
38266.flavor: So you say you want an evolution. Well, you know. We all want to change the board.

38267.name: Thing from Below
38267.text: [x]Taunt Costs (1) less for each Totem you've summoned this game.
38267.flavor: Just can't resist the opportunity to hang around with a bunch of totems.

430.name: Cone of Cold
430.text: Freeze a minion and the minions next to it, and deal $1 damage to them.
430.flavor: Magi of the Kirin Tor were casting Cubes of Cold for many years before Cones came into fashion some 90 years ago.

39495.name: Protect the King!
39495.text: For each enemy minion, summon a 1/1 Pawn with Taunt.
39495.flavor: Form ranks! Everyone into the King's Tuskarr Defense!
39495.howToGet: Unlocked in the Parlor, in One Night in Karazhan.
39495.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Parlor, in One Night in Karazhan.

39694.name: Spirit Claws
39694.flavor: They'll be MUCH easier to use once they add the spiritthumb.
39694.howToGet: Unlocked in the Spire, in One Night in Karazhan.
39694.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Spire, in One Night in Karazhan.

39696.name: Menagerie Warden
39696.text: Battlecry: Choose a friendly Beast. Summon a_copy of it.
39696.flavor: Please? Can I keep him? I promise to clean his cage every day.
39696.howToGet: Unlocked in the Menagerie, in One Night in Karazhan.
39696.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Menagerie, in One Night in Karazhan.

1941.name: Echo of Medivh
1941.text: Put a copy of each friendly minion into your hand.
1941.flavor: Medivh's echo haunts Karazhan, eternally cheating at chess and Hearthstone.

338.name: Grommash Hellscream
338.flavor: Grommash drank the tainted blood of Mannoroth, dooming the orcs to green skin and red eyes!  Maybe not his best decision.

2610.name: Totem Golem
2610.flavor: What happens when you glue a buncha totems together.

336.name: Baron Geddon
336.text: At the end of your turn, deal 2 damage to ALL other characters.
336.flavor: Baron Geddon was Ragnaros's foremost lieutenant, until he got FIRED.

39698.name: Swashburglar
39698.text: Battlecry: Add a random class card to your hand (from your opponent's class).
39698.howToGet: Unlocked in the Opera, in One Night in Karazhan.
39698.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Opera, in One Night in Karazhan.

2618.name: The Mistcaller
2618.text: Battlecry: Give all minions in your hand and deck +1/+1.
2618.flavor: Calling the mist doesn't sound all that great.  "Ooooh, it is slightly damp now!"

2061.name: Target Dummy
2061.flavor: The engineering equivalent of a "Kick Me" sticker.

2087.name: Blingtron 3000
2087.text: Battlecry: Equip a random weapon for each player.
2087.flavor: PREPARE PARTY SERVOS FOR IMMEDIATE DEPLOYMENT.

854.name: Humility
854.flavor: This card makes something really damp.  Oh wait.  That's "Humidity."

38505.name: Yogg-Saron, Hope's End
38505.text: Battlecry: Cast a random spell for each spell you've cast this game (targets chosen randomly).
38505.flavor: I spell your doom... Y-O-U-R D-O-O-M!

858.name: Gelbin Mekkatorque
858.flavor: He's the leader of the gnomes, and an incredible inventor.  He's getting better, too; He turns things into chickens WAY less than he used to.
858.howToGetGold: This was rewarded to players who helped test the Store during the Beta.

859.name: Twisting Nether
859.flavor: The Twisting Nether is a formless place of magic and illusion and destroyed minions.

555.name: Arcane Intellect
555.flavor: Playing this card makes you SMARTER.  And let's face it: we could all stand to be a little smarter.

38312.name: Y'Shaarj, Rage Unbound
38312.text: At the end of your turn, put a minion from your deck into the battlefield.
38312.flavor: When he's working out, he binds all that rage back into a ponytail.

2062.name: Jeeves
2062.text: At the end of each player's turn, that player draws until they have 3 cards.
2062.flavor: This robot is a lean, mean, butlerin' machine.

39380.name: Silverware Golem
39380.text: If you discard this minion, summon it.
39380.flavor: From the secret research labs of the Swiss Army.
39380.howToGet: Unlocked in the Parlor, in One Night in Karazhan.
39380.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Parlor, in One Night in Karazhan.

39225.name: The Curator
39225.text: Taunt Battlecry: Draw a Beast, Dragon, and Murloc from your deck.
39225.flavor: The Curator guards Azeroth’s deadliest creatures, but it’s secretly terrified of squirrels.
39225.howToGet: Unlocked in the Menagerie, in One Night in Karazhan.
39225.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Menagerie, in One Night in Karazhan.

2681.name: The Skeleton Knight
2681.text: Deathrattle: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, return this to your hand.
2681.flavor: Apparently it really was just a flesh wound.

2682.name: Chillmaw
2682.text: [x]Taunt Deathrattle: If you're holding a Dragon, deal 3 damage to all minions.
2682.flavor: Chillmaw keeps trying to ruin the Grand Tournament, and she would've done it too, if it weren't for those dang kids!

2683.name: Nexus-Champion Saraad
2683.text: Inspire: Add a random spell to your hand.
2683.flavor: The ethereals have their own jousting tournament, and Saraad is the reigning champion.  Also he won the ethereal hot dog eating contest.

38918.name: Blood To Ichor
38918.text: Deal $1 damage to a minion. If it survives, summon a 2/2 Slime.
38918.flavor: For his next trick, he turns the ichor back to blood and stuffs it back in you.

38910.name: Princess Huhuran
38910.flavor: She flitters around Ahn'Qiraj dreaming of the day she will meet a sweet prince, whom she can lay thousands of eggs with.

38911.name: Steward of Darkshire
38911.text: Whenever you summon a 1-Health minion, give it Divine Shield.
38911.flavor: Turns out divine shields are way cheaper if you buy in bulk.

545.name: Mind Blast
545.text: Deal $5 damage to the enemy hero.
545.flavor: This spell blasts you directly in the MIND.

38914.name: N'Zoth's First Mate
38914.flavor: Hates when N'Zoth yells "Ahoy Matey!!", but there's not really much he can do about it.

38916.name: Addled Grizzly
38916.text: After you summon a minion, give it +1/+1.
38916.flavor: Druids who spend too long in bear form are more susceptible to the whispers of the Old Gods.  Right now they are whispering the lyrics to "La Bamba".

2615.name: Thunder Bluff Valiant
2615.flavor: Allowing totems to attack is not cheating.  I mean, there isn't anything in the rule books about it.

38727.name: Call of the Wild
38727.flavor: "Hello. Misha, Leokk and Huffer aren't here right now, but if you leave a message we'll get back to you right away." BEEP.

90.name: Chillwind Yeti
90.flavor: He always dreamed of coming down from the mountains and opening a noodle shop, but he never got the nerve.

38725.name: Faceless Summoner
38725.flavor: They never get the recognition they deserve.

38724.name: Stormcrack
38724.flavor: WARNING: DO NOT TOUCH THE PURPLE BALL OF LIGHTNING

95.name: Nourish
95.text: Choose One - Gain 2 Mana Crystals; or Draw 3 cards.
95.flavor: Druids take nourishment from many things: the power of nature, the songbird's chirp, a chocolate cake.

38722.name: Hallazeal the Ascended
38722.text: Whenever your spells deal damage, restore that much Health to your hero.

1991.name: Feign Death
1991.flavor: The hardest part about doing a "Feign Death" convincingly is learning how to make the right smell. It takes a lot of commitment.

39747.name: Ironforge Portal
39747.text:
Gain 4 Armor.
Summon a random
4-Cost minion.
39747.flavor: Come to beautiful Ironforge! Where irons are forged and the forges are iron!
39747.howToGet: Unlocked in the Spire, in One Night in Karazhan.
39747.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Spire, in One Night in Karazhan.

1993.name: Trade Prince Gallywix
1993.text: Whenever your opponent casts a spell, gain a copy of it and give them a Coin.
1993.flavor: Gallywix believes in supply and demand. He supplies the beatings and demands you pay up!

1992.name: Iron Sensei
1992.text: At the end of your turn, give another friendly Mech +2/+2.
1992.flavor:
Mechs like learning from him because he really speaks their language.

0110100001101001

1995.name: Recycle
1995.text: Shuffle an enemy minion into your opponent's deck.
1995.flavor: Druidic recycling involves putting plastics in one bin and enemy minions in another bin.

38530.name: Ravaging Ghoul
38530.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage to all other minions.
38530.flavor: But goes by "Ravishing Ghoul" when he hits the club.

39740.name: Malchezaar's Imp
39740.text: Whenever you discard a card, draw a card.
39740.flavor: Malchezaar used to have an imp named Dobby working for him, but there was a tragic accident.
39740.howToGet: Unlocked in the Spire, in One Night in Karazhan.
39740.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Spire, in One Night in Karazhan.

814.name: Snipe
814.text: Secret: After your opponent plays a minion, deal $4 damage to it.
814.flavor: A great sniper hits the spot.  Just like a delicious flank of boar. Mmmmm.

2047.name: Force-Tank MAX
2047.flavor: There is a factory in Tanaris for crafting force-tanks, but it only ever made two, because of cost overruns.

2064.name: Piloted Shredder
2064.flavor: Once upon a time, only goblins piloted shredders. These days, everyone from Doomsayer to Lorewalker Cho seems to ride one.

969.name: Summoning Portal
969.text: Your minions cost (2) less, but not less than (1).
969.flavor: NOT LESS THAN 1!  Don't get any ideas!

39034.name: Shifting Shade
39034.text: Deathrattle: Copy a card from your opponent's deck and add it to your hand.
39034.flavor: Yeah, it's cooler in the shade, but you're also more likely to get JACKED.

38792.name: Eater of Secrets
38792.text: Battlecry: Destroy all enemy Secrets. Gain +1/+1 for each.
38792.flavor: You don't want to be around after it has eaten an explosive trap.  You thought Sludge Belcher was bad...

742.name: Savage Roar
742.text: Give your characters +2 Attack this turn.
742.flavor: What do they roar? Nobody can quite tell, but it sounds like "Elephant Macho Breeze".  It's probably not that, though.

2575.name: Tournament Medic
2575.flavor: The medic tournament is less entertaining than the Grand Tournament.

559.name: Leeroy Jenkins
559.text: Charge. Battlecry: Summon two 1/1 Whelps for your opponent.
559.flavor: At least he has Angry Chicken.

748.name: Kirin Tor Mage
748.text: Battlecry: The next Secret you play this turn costs (0).
748.flavor: The Kirin Tor reside in the floating city of Dalaran.  How do you make a Dalaran float?  Two scoops of ice cream, one scoop of Dalaran.

749.name: Bloodmage Thalnos
749.flavor: He's in charge of the Annual Scarlet Monastery Blood Drive!

556.name: Illidan Stormrage
556.text: Whenever you play a card, summon a 2/1 Flame of Azzinoth.
556.flavor: Illidan's brother, Malfurion, imprisoned him beneath Hyjal for 10,000 years.  Stormrages are not good at letting go of grudges.

38447.name: Darkshire Librarian
38447.text: Battlecry: Discard a random card. Deathrattle: Draw a card.
38447.flavor: Do NOT be late with your overdue fines.

238.name: Feral Spirit
238.flavor: Spirit wolves are like regular wolves with pom-poms.

239.name: Rockbiter Weapon
239.text: Give a friendly character +3 Attack this turn.
239.flavor: This would be real handy if your enemy is made of rock.

2949.name: Brann Bronzebeard
2949.flavor: Contains 75% more fiber than his brother Magni!
2949.howToGet: Unlocked in Uldaman, in the League of Explorers adventure.
2949.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Uldaman, in the League of Explorers adventure.

2948.name: Sir Finley Mrrgglton
2948.text: Battlecry: Discover a new basic Hero Power.
2948.flavor: In addition to fluent Common, he also speaks fourteen dialects of 'mrgl'.
2948.howToGet: Unlocked in The Ruined City, in the League of Explorers adventure.
2948.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in The Ruined City, in the League of Explorers adventure.

712.name: War Golem
712.flavor: Golems are not afraid, but for some reason they still run when you cast Fear on them.  Instinct, maybe?  A desire to blend in?

2945.name: Fossilized Devilsaur
2945.text: Battlecry: If you control a Beast, gain Taunt.
2945.flavor: This was the only job he could get after the dinosaur theme park debacle.
2945.howToGet: Unlocked in the Hall of Explorers, in the League of Explorers adventure.
2945.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Hall of Explorers, in the League of Explorers adventure.

3015.name: Entomb
3015.text:
Choose an enemy minion.
Shuffle it into your deck.
3015.flavor: It's perfectly safe as long as you remember to put in air holes.
3015.howToGet: Unlocked in The Ruined City, in the League of Explorers adventure.
3015.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in The Ruined City, in the League of Explorers adventure.

38961.name: Polluted Hoarder
38961.flavor: Roll ‘greed’ OR THIS COULD HAPPEN TO YOU.

38960.name: Blackwater Pirate
38960.flavor: "Look, they fell off the back of a ship, do you want them or not? I have a meeting with Y'Shaarj in like ten minutes."

232.name: Repentance
232.text: Secret: After your opponent plays a minion, reduce its Health to 1.
232.flavor: Repentance often comes in the moment before obliteration. Curious.

233.name: Naturalize
233.text: Destroy a minion. Your opponent draws 2 cards.

1050.name: Claw
1050.text: Give your hero +2 Attack this turn and 2 Armor.
1050.flavor: The claw decides who will stay and who will go.

237.name: Auchenai Soulpriest
237.text: Your cards and powers that restore Health now deal damage instead.
237.flavor: The Auchenai know the end is coming, but they're not sure when.

38393.name: Journey Below
38393.flavor: Don't stop believing there's something below.

2225.name: Grove Tender
2225.text: Choose One - Give each player a Mana Crystal; or Each player draws a card.
2225.flavor: Likes: Hiking and the great outdoors. Dislikes: Goblin shredders and sandals. (Can’t find any that fit!).

1793.name: Sludge Belcher
1793.flavor: DO NOT GIVE HIM A ROOT BEER.
1793.howToGet: Unlocked in The Plague Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1793.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in The Plague Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.

1693.name: King Mukla
1693.flavor: King Mukla wanders Jaguero Isle, searching for love.

2704.name: Refreshment Vendor
2704.flavor: Menu:  Funnel cakes, carrots, popcorn, jormungar steaks.  It's hard serving a diverse clientele.

1754.name: Elite Tauren Chieftain
1754.text: Battlecry: Give both players the power to ROCK! (with a Power Chord card)
1754.flavor: He's looking for a drummer.  The current candidates are: Novice Engineer, Sen'jin Shieldmasta', and Ragnaros the Firelord.

1753.name: Zombie Chow
1753.text: Deathrattle: Restore 5 Health to the enemy hero.
1753.howToGet: Unlocked in The Construct Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1753.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in The Construct Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.

1791.name: Maexxna
1791.text: Destroy any minion damaged by this minion.
1791.flavor: Maexxna gets super mad when people introduce her as "Maxina" or "Maxxy".
1791.howToGet: Unlocked in The Arachnid Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1791.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in The Arachnid Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.

147.name: Shadowflame
147.text: Destroy a friendly minion and deal its Attack damage to all enemy minions.
147.flavor: Start with a powerful minion and stir in Shadowflame and you have a good time!

618.name: Dust Devil
618.flavor: Westfall is full of dust devils. And buzzards. And crazed golems. And pirates. Why does anyone live here?

1174.name: Avenging Wrath
1174.text: Deal $8 damage randomly split among all enemies.
1174.flavor: Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham!

38864.name: Twilight Geomancer
38864.flavor: "Ok C'Thun, repeat after me: 'Your mother was a hamster.'"

140.name: Redemption
140.text: Secret: When one of your minions dies, return it to life with 1 Health.
140.flavor: I am not sure how you get demptioned the first time.  It’s a mystery!

141.name: Hunter's Mark
141.flavor: Never play 'Hide and Go Seek' with a Hunter.

38868.name: Twilight Elder
38868.text: At the end of your turn, give your C'Thun +1/+1 (wherever it is).
38868.flavor: Just doesn't understand those Twilight Youngsters any more - with their comic books and their rock music.

613.name: Power Word: Shield
613.text:
Give a minion +2 Health.
Draw a card.
613.flavor: Sure the extra protection is nice, but the shield really reduces visibility.

614.name: Sorcerer's Apprentice
614.flavor: Apprentices are great for bossing around.  "Conjure me some mana buns! And a coffee!  Make that a mana coffee!"

149.name: Ancestral Healing
149.text: Restore a minion to full Health and give it Taunt.
149.flavor: I personally prefer some non-ancestral right-the-heck-now healing, but maybe that is just me.

39350.name: Enchanted Raven
39350.flavor: Once upon a midnight restive, Medivh pondered, feeling festive!
39350.howToGet: Unlocked in the Prologue, in One Night in Karazhan.
39350.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Prologue, in One Night in Karazhan.

38895.name: The Boogeymonster
38895.text: Whenever this attacks and kills a minion, gain +2/+2.
38895.flavor: Has 20 years of training in classical ballet, but ALLLLLL he ever gets asked to do is boogie.

39033.name: Hooded Acolyte
39033.text: Whenever a character is healed, give your C'Thun +1/+1 (wherever it is).
39033.flavor: Wait, what kind of acolyte doesn't wear a hood?

710.name: Sinister Strike
710.text: Deal $3 damage to the enemy hero.
710.flavor: There's something about this strike that just feels off.  Sinister, even.

2088.name: Hemet Nesingwary
2088.flavor: It's hard to make a living as a hunter in a world where beasts instantly reappear minutes after you kill them.

1004.name: Flamestrike
1004.text: Deal $4 damage to all enemy minions.
1004.flavor: When the ground is on fire, you should not stop, drop, and roll.

1281.name: Scavenging Hyena
1281.text: Whenever a friendly Beast dies, gain +2/+1.
1281.flavor: Hyenas prefer the bones of kodos or windserpents, but they'll eat pretty much anything.  Even Brussels sprouts.

2082.name: Sneed's Old Shredder
2082.flavor: When Sneed was defeated in the Deadmines, his shredder was sold at auction to an anonymous buyer. (Probably Hogger.)

2083.name: Toshley
2083.text: Battlecry and Deathrattle: Add a Spare Part card to your hand.

2080.name: Mogor the Ogre
2080.text: All minions have a 50% chance to attack the wrong enemy.
2080.flavor: Mogor helped reopen the Dark Portal once. You know you're in trouble when you have to rely on an ogre.

2081.name: Foe Reaper 4000
2081.text: Also damages the minions next to whomever he attacks.
2081.flavor: Foe reaping is really not so different from harvest reaping, at the end of the day.

2086.name: Troggzor the Earthinator
2086.text: Whenever your opponent casts a spell, summon a Burly Rockjaw Trogg.
2086.flavor: He keeps earthinating the countryside despite attempts to stop him.

39453.name: Moroes
39453.text: Stealth At the end of your turn, summon a 1/1 Steward.
39453.flavor: Moroes runs an army of stewards, but still ends up inflating the balloons himself.
39453.howToGet: Unlocked in the Parlor, in One Night in Karazhan.
39453.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Parlor, in One Night in Karazhan.

940.name: Cleave
940.text: Deal $2 damage to two random enemy minions.
940.flavor: Hey you two…could you stand next to each other for a second…

2085.name: Gazlowe
2085.text: Whenever you cast a 1-mana spell, add a random Mech to your hand.
2085.flavor: Gazlowe was voted "Most Likely to Explode" in high school.

2539.name: Flame Lance
2539.flavor: It's on the rack next to ice lance, acid lance, and English muffin lance.

2060.name: Gnomish Experimenter
2060.text: Battlecry: Draw a card. If it's a minion, transform it into a Chicken.
2060.flavor: He's legitimately surprised every time he turns himself into a chicken.

2532.name: Frigid Snobold
2532.flavor: Ironically, the natural enemy of the snobold is THE CANDLE.

2533.name: Dragonhawk Rider
2533.flavor: Check it out.  You can do barrel rolls on this thing.

680.name: Southsea Captain
680.flavor: When he saves enough plunder, he's going to commission an enormous captain's hat.  He has hat envy.

2535.name: Demonfuse
2535.text: Give a Demon +3/+3. Give your opponent a Mana Crystal.
2535.flavor: Very dangerous when attached to a demonbomb.

2040.name: Shadowboxer
2040.text: Whenever a character is healed, deal 1 damage to a random enemy.
2040.flavor: Punching is its primary function. Also, its secondary function.

2711.name: Orgrimmar Aspirant
2711.flavor: "Four out of three orcs struggle with math." - Angry Zurge

2717.name: Seal of Champions
2717.text: Give a minion +3 Attack and Divine Shield.

459.name: Deadly Poison
459.flavor: Rogues guard the secrets to poison-making carefully, lest magi start incorporating poison into their spells.  Poisonbolt? Rain of Poison?  Poison Elemental?  Nobody wants that.

2596.name: Wyrmrest Agent
2596.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, gain +1 Attack and Taunt.
2596.flavor: Keeping tabs on the Grand Tournament is priority #1 for the five mighty Dragonflights!

2655.name: Murloc Knight
2655.flavor: Hee hee!  Look at his cute little feet.

2654.name: Enter the Coliseum
2654.text: Destroy all minions except each player's highest Attack minion.
2654.flavor: You have to get past the vendors first.  So many are lost to shopping...

38547.name: Disciple of C'Thun
38547.text: Battlecry: Deal 2 damage. Give your C'Thun +2/+2 (wherever it is).
38547.flavor: C’Thun’s recruiting pitch involves cookies, which is why it’s the most popular Old God.

132.name: Voodoo Doctor
132.flavor: Voodoo is an oft-misunderstood art. But it is art.

38545.name: Corrupted Seer
38545.text: Battlecry: Deal 2 damage to all non-Murloc minions.
38545.flavor: For seers, it's very handy to have your crystal ball hanging right in front of your face.

38797.name: Spawn of N'Zoth
38797.flavor: Who's a cute widdle N'Zoth? You are! Yes you are! Yes you're the cutest widdle N'Zoth in the whole world!!!

38541.name: Zealous Initiate
38541.flavor: Ok, Initiate. You need to settle down and do your job. In this case, that means die so someone else can get a minor buff.

134.name: Ravenholdt Assassin
134.flavor: Just mail him a package with a name and 10,000 gold.  He'll take care of the rest.

496.name: Frostwolf Warlord
496.text: Battlecry: Gain +1/+1 for each other friendly minion on the battlefield.
496.flavor: The Frostwolves are locked in combat with the Stormpike Expedition over control of Alterac Valley.  Every attempt at peace-talks has ended with Captain Galvangar killing the mediator.

138.name: Doomsayer
138.text: At the start of your turn, destroy ALL minions.
138.flavor: He's almost been right so many times. He was sure it was coming during the Cataclysm.

493.name: Force of Nature
493.flavor: "I think I'll just nap under these trees. Wait... AAAAAHHH!" - Blinkfizz, the Unfortunate Gnome

38468.name: Mukla, Tyrant of the Vale
38468.flavor: Pro tip: DO NOT BOGART THE BANANAS.

22.name: Inner Rage
22.text: Deal $1 damage to a minion and give it +2 Attack.
22.flavor: They're only smiling on the outside.

23.name: Bane of Doom
23.text: Deal $2 damage to a character. If that kills it, summon a random Demon.
23.flavor: My advice to you is to avoid Doom, if possible.

38464.name: Cho'gall
38464.text: Battlecry: The next spell you cast this turn costs Health instead of Mana.
38464.flavor: Even after all this time, Gul'dan still makes Cho'gall go get donuts and coffee.

28.name: Kor'kron Elite
28.flavor: The Kor'kron are the elite forces of Garrosh Hellscream. Let's just say you don't want to run into these guys while wearing a blue tabard.

38461.name: Renounce Darkness
38461.text: Replace your Hero Power and Warlock cards with another class's. The cards cost (1) less.

1371.name: Stampeding Kodo
1371.text: Battlecry: Destroy a random enemy minion with 2 or less Attack.
1371.flavor: This Kodo is so big that he can stampede by himself.

1370.name: Oasis Snapjaw
1370.flavor: His dreams of flying and breathing fire like his idol will never be realized.

405.name: Mana Wyrm
405.text: Whenever you cast a spell, gain +1 Attack.
405.flavor: These wyrms feed on arcane energies, and while they are generally considered a nuisance rather than a real threat, you really shouldn't leave them alone with a bucket of mana.

404.name: Ancestral Spirit
404.text: Give a minion "Deathrattle: Resummon this minion."
404.flavor: It was just a flesh wound.

2019.name: Warbot
2019.flavor: Mass production of warbots was halted when it was discovered that they were accidentally being produced at "sample size."

2018.name: Bouncing Blade
2018.text: Deal $1 damage to a random minion. Repeat until a minion dies.
2018.flavor: Only goblins would think this was a good idea. Even they are starting to have their doubts.

401.name: Fiery War Axe
401.flavor: During times of tranquility and harmony, this weapon was called by its less popular name, Chilly Peace Axe.

400.name: Battle Rage
400.text: Draw a card for each damaged friendly character.
400.flavor: "You won't like me when I'm angry."

2015.name: Sabotage
2015.text: Destroy a random enemy minion. Combo: And your opponent's weapon.
2015.flavor: Rogues can't stand it. They know you planned it! They are going to set you straight!

932.name: Gadgetzan Auctioneer
932.text: Whenever you cast a spell, draw a card.
932.flavor: He used to run the black market auction house, but there was just too much violence and he had to move.

2017.name: Gahz'rilla
2017.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, double its Attack.
2017.flavor: The Sen'jin High football team is The Gahz'rillas.

2016.name: Metaltooth Leaper
2016.flavor: Don't leave them out in the rain. In Un'Goro Crater there is a whole colony of rust-tooth leapers.

2011.name: Glaivezooka
2011.text: Battlecry: Give a random friendly minion +1 Attack.
2011.flavor: For the times when a regular bazooka just isn't enough.

2010.name: Neptulon
2010.text: Battlecry: Add 4 random Murlocs to your hand. Overload: (3)
2010.flavor: Neptulon is "The Tidehunter". He’s one of the four elemental lords. And he and Ragnaros get together and make really amazing saunas.

2408.name: Blackwing Technician
2408.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, gain +1/+1.
2408.flavor: This is who you go to when your Blackwing needs a tune up. Don't go to a cut rate Blackwing tune up shop!
2408.howToGet: Unlocked in Molten Core, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2408.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Molten Core, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.

2409.name: Blackwing Corruptor
2409.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, deal 3 damage.
2409.flavor: He got his name when he gave Blackwing some comic books and rock & roll records.
2409.howToGet: Unlocked in Hidden Laboratory, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2409.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Hidden Laboratory, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.

2030.name: Cobalt Guardian
2030.text: Whenever you summon a Mech, gain Divine Shield.
2030.flavor: Guardians used to be built out of Adamantium, but production got moved to Gadgetzan and Cobalt was cheap.

2595.name: Bolf Ramshield
2595.text: Whenever your hero takes damage, this minion takes it instead.
2595.flavor: Bolf keeps coming in 2nd at the Grand Tournament.  It might be his year this year, if Lebron doesn't enter.

38334.name: Feral Rage
38334.text: Choose One - Give your hero +4 Attack this turn; or Gain 8 Armor.
38334.flavor: Let's be honest. One option is a lot ragier than the other.

38900.name: Cult Sorcerer
38900.text: [x]Spell Damage +1 After you cast a spell, give your C'Thun +1/+1 (wherever it is).
38900.flavor: No matter how many times we tell her not to, she keeps feeding C'Thun scraps under the table.

39700.name: Ethereal Peddler
39700.text: [x]Battlecry: Reduce the Cost of cards in your hand from other classes by (2).
39700.flavor: Yeah, sure. That Ragnaros "fell off the back of a truck".
39700.howToGet: Unlocked in the Spire, in One Night in Karazhan.
39700.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Spire, in One Night in Karazhan.

38958.name: Crazed Worshipper
38958.text: Taunt. Whenever this minion takes damage, give your C'Thun +1/+1 (wherever it is).
38958.flavor: Every month they share a pancake breakfast with the Perfectly Rational Worshippers.

825.name: Azure Drake
825.flavor: They initially planned to be the Beryl or Cerulean drakes, but those felt a tad too pretentious.

36111.name: Animated Armor
36111.text: Your hero can only take 1 damage at a time.
36111.flavor: Try putting it on.  Wait, let me get my camera.
36111.howToGet: Unlocked in the Hall of Explorers, in the League of Explorers adventure.
36111.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Hall of Explorers, in the League of Explorers adventure.

374.name: Ragnaros the Firelord
374.text: Can't attack. At the end of your turn, deal 8 damage to a random enemy.
374.flavor: Ragnaros was summoned by the Dark Iron dwarves, who were eventually enslaved by the Firelord.  Summoning Ragnaros often doesn’t work out the way you want it to.

823.name: Starfire
823.flavor: Balance is important to druids.  This card is perfectly balanced.

376.name: Inner Fire
376.text: Change a minion's Attack to be equal to its Health.
376.flavor: Good idea: Buffing your minions.  Bad idea: Starting a conversation in the Barrens.

38920.name: Bloodsail Cultist
38920.text: Battlecry: If you control another Pirate, give your weapon +1/+1.
38920.flavor: They're really just in it for the Blood Parrot.

2901.name: Jeweled Scarab
2901.flavor: It's amazing what you can do with super glue!
2901.howToGet: Unlocked in the Temple of Orsis, in the League of Explorers adventure.
2901.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Temple of Orsis, in the League of Explorers adventure.

38412.name: Demented Frostcaller
38412.text: After you cast a spell, Freeze a random enemy.
38412.flavor: He prefers that you refer to him by his nickname: 'Frostwaker.'

708.name: Headcrack
708.text: Deal $2 damage to the enemy hero. Combo: Return this to your hand next turn.
708.flavor: When all else fails, nothing beats a swift whack upside the head.

38426.name: Power Word: Tentacles
38426.flavor: Because you're wrapped in a protective layer of… tentacles?

38861.name: Blade of C'Thun
38861.text: Battlecry: Destroy a minion. Add its Attack and Health to_your C'Thun's (wherever it is).
38861.flavor: C'Thun demands a sacrifice! Preferably a Deathwing.

700.name: Mogu'shan Warden
700.flavor: All these guys ever do is talk about the Thunder King.   BOOOORRRINNG!

38774.name: Possessed Villager
38774.flavor: It's like a pinata! A lame disgusting horrific pinata.

391.name: Perdition's Blade
391.flavor: Perdition's Blade is Ragnaros's back-up weapon while Sulfuras is in the shop.

145.name: Mindgames
145.text: Put a copy of a random minion from your opponent's deck into the battlefield.
145.flavor: Sometimes it feels like this is all a game.

397.name: Flesheating Ghoul
397.text: Whenever a minion dies, gain +1 Attack.
397.flavor: 'Flesheating' is an unfair name.  It's just that there's not really much else for him to eat.

395.name: Water Elemental
395.text: Freeze any character damaged by this minion.
395.flavor: Don't summon a water elemental at a party.  It'll dampen the mood.

394.name: Explosive Shot
394.text: Deal $5 damage to a minion and $2 damage to adjacent ones.
394.flavor: Pull the pin, count to 5, then shoot.  Then duck.

38764.name: Darkshire Alchemist
38764.flavor: The secret ingredient: liquified funnel cake.

86.name: Starfall
86.text: Choose One - Deal $5 damage to a minion; or $2 damage to all enemy minions.
86.flavor: Is the sky falling?  Yes.  Yes it is.

797.name: Lightwell
797.text: At the start of your turn, restore 3 Health to a damaged friendly character.
797.flavor: It isn't clear if people ignore the Lightwell, or if it is just invisible.

2308.name: Rend Blackhand
2308.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, destroy a Legendary minion.
2308.flavor: Rend believes he is the True Warchief of the Horde and he keeps editing the wikipedia page for "Warchief of the Horde" to include his picture.
2308.howToGet: Unlocked in Blackrock Spire, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2308.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Blackrock Spire, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.

1171.name: Bloodlust
1171.text: Give your minions +3 Attack this turn.

791.name: Questing Adventurer
791.text: Whenever you play a card, gain +1/+1.
791.flavor: "Does anyone have some extra Boar Pelts?"

790.name: Amani Berserker
790.flavor: If an Amani berserker asks "Joo lookin' at me?!", the correct response is "Nah, mon".

2301.name: Demonwrath
2301.text: Deal $2 damage to all non-Demon minions.
2301.flavor: Demons are not angry most of the time. You have to play this card in order to really bring it out of them.
2301.howToGet: Unlocked in Blackwing Lair, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2301.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Blackwing Lair, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.

2304.name: Gang Up
2304.text: Choose a minion. Shuffle 3 copies of it into your deck.
2304.flavor: If you are thinking about visiting Moonbrook, you better roll deep.
2304.howToGet: Unlocked in Blackrock Depths, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2304.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Blackrock Depths, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.

2306.name: Dragonkin Sorcerer
2306.text: Whenever you target this minion with a spell, gain +1/+1.
2306.flavor: Dragonkin Sorcerers be all "I'm a wizard" and everyone else be all "daaaaang".
2306.howToGet: Unlocked in Hidden Laboratory, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2306.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Hidden Laboratory, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.

1658.name: Alarm-o-Bot
1658.text: At the start of your turn, swap this minion with a random one in your hand.

1659.name: Acolyte of Pain
1659.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, draw a card.
1659.flavor: He trained when he was younger to be an acolyte of joy, but things didn’t work out like he thought they would.

39003.name: Squirming Tentacle
39003.flavor: Yeah, I think we can agree that killing the squirming tentacle first is a good idea.

39002.name: Duskboar
39002.flavor: Often excluded from dinner parties.  To be fair, he is very boaring.

1653.name: Magma Rager
1653.flavor: He likes to think he is powerful, but pretty much anyone can solo Molten Core now.

1650.name: Northshire Cleric
1650.text: Whenever a minion is healed, draw a card.
1650.flavor: They help the downtrodden and distressed.  Also they sell cookies.

1651.name: Earthen Ring Farseer
1651.flavor: He can see really far, and he doesn't use a telescope like those filthy pirates.

1656.name: The Black Knight
1656.flavor: He was sent by the Lich King to disrupt the Argent Tournament.   We can pretty much mark that a failure.

1657.name: Big Game Hunter
1657.text: Battlecry: Destroy a minion with an Attack of 7 or more.
1657.flavor: Mere devilsaurs no longer excite him.  Soon he'll be trying to catch Onyxia with only a dull Krol Blade.

1655.name: Lightwarden
1655.text: Whenever a character is healed, gain +2 Attack.
1655.flavor: She’s smaller than her sisters Mediumwarden and Heavywarden.

2286.name: Twilight Whelp
2286.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, gain +2 Health.
2286.flavor: The twilight whelps are basically magic-vampires. Despite this, they are not a reference to any popular series of novels.
2286.howToGet: Unlocked in Blackrock Spire, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2286.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Blackrock Spire, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.

2289.name: Lava Shock
2289.text: Deal $2 damage. Unlock your Overloaded Mana Crystals.
2289.flavor: Chocolate lava cake is shockingly delicious.
2289.howToGet: Unlocked in Molten Core, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2289.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Molten Core, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.

584.name: Noble Sacrifice
584.text: Secret: When an enemy attacks, summon a 2/1 Defender as the new target.

585.name: Explosive Trap
585.text: Secret: When your hero is attacked, deal $2 damage to all enemies.
585.flavor: It traps your food AND cooks it for you!

582.name: Darkscale Healer
582.text: Battlecry: Restore 2 Health to all friendly characters.
582.flavor: Healing is just something she does in her free time.  It's more of a hobby really.

581.name: Alexstrasza
581.text: Battlecry: Set a hero's remaining Health to 15.
581.flavor: Alexstrasza the Life-Binder brings life and hope to everyone.  Except Deathwing.  And Malygos.  And Nekros.

1133.name: Patient Assassin
1133.text: Stealth. Destroy any minion damaged by this minion.
1133.flavor: He’s not really that patient. It just takes a while for someone to walk by that he can actually reach.

2281.name: Majordomo Executus
2281.text: Deathrattle: Replace your hero with Ragnaros, the Firelord.
2281.flavor: You thought Executus turned you into Ragnaros, but really Ragnaros was in you the whole time.
2281.howToGet: Unlocked in Molten Core, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2281.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Molten Core, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.

2283.name: Hungry Dragon
2283.text: Battlecry: Summon a random 1-Cost minion for your opponent.
2283.flavor: Hungry Hungry Dragon is NOT a fun game.
2283.howToGet: Unlocked in Blackwing Lair, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2283.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Blackwing Lair, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.

2284.name: Dragon's Breath
2284.text: Deal $4 damage. Costs (1) less for each minion that died this turn.
2284.flavor: Dragons breathe fire, sure, but did you know they can also breathe Cotton Candy?  It's harder to give them a reason to do that, though.
2284.howToGet: Unlocked in Blackrock Depths, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2284.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Blackrock Depths, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.

1135.name: Lorewalker Cho
1135.text: Whenever a player casts a spell, put a copy into the other player’s hand.
1135.flavor: Lorewalker Cho archives and shares tales from the land of Pandaria, but his favorite story is the one where Joey and Phoebe go on a road trip.

2792.name: Living Roots
2792.text: Choose One - Deal $2 damage; or Summon two 1/1 Saplings.
2792.flavor: 2 out of 2 saplings recommend that you summon the saplings.

974.name: Soulfire
974.text: Deal $4 damage. Discard a random card.
974.flavor: Are you lighting a soul on fire? Or burning someone with your OWN soul? This seems like an important distinction.

39417.name: Fool's Bane
39417.text: Unlimited attacks each turn. Can't attack heroes.
39417.flavor: A fool and his bane are soon parted.
39417.howToGet: Unlocked in the Menagerie, in One Night in Karazhan.
39417.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Menagerie, in One Night in Karazhan.

242.name: Abusive Sergeant
242.text: Battlecry: Give a minion +2 Attack this turn.
242.flavor: ADD ME TO YOUR DECK, MAGGOT!

1982.name: Fel Reaver
1982.text: Whenever your opponent plays a card, remove the top 3 cards of your deck.

922.name: Goldshire Footman
922.flavor: If 1/2 minions are all that is defending Goldshire, you would think it would have been overrun years ago.

2275.name: Flamewaker
2275.text: After you cast a spell, deal 2 damage randomly split among all enemies.
2275.flavor: Flamewakers HATE being confused for Flamewalkers. They just wake up fire, they don’t walk on it. Walking on fire is CRAZY.
2275.howToGet: Unlocked in Blackwing Lair, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2275.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Blackwing Lair, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.

2274.name: Solemn Vigil
2274.text: Draw 2 cards. Costs (1) less for each minion that died this turn.
2274.flavor: Each year, folk gather in front of Blackrock Mountain to mourn those who were mind-controlled into the lava.
2274.howToGet: Unlocked in Hidden Laboratory, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2274.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Hidden Laboratory, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.

971.name: Frost Shock
971.text: Deal $1 damage to an enemy character and Freeze it.

2579.name: Silent Knight
2579.flavor: He used to be a librarian.  Old habits die hard.

2576.name: Saboteur
2576.text: Battlecry: Your opponent's Hero Power costs (5) more next turn.
2576.flavor: Listen all y'all it's a saboteur!

2577.name: Lance Carrier
2577.flavor: Lance Carrier is an obscure entry level position in orcish armies.  A mystery, since orcs don't generally use lances.

2793.name: Mulch
2793.text:
Destroy a minion.
Add a random minion to your opponent's hand.
2793.flavor: Is this a noun or a verb?  We will never know.

2279.name: Grim Patron
2279.text: Whenever this minion survives damage, summon another Grim Patron.
2279.flavor: If you love getting your face punched, come to the Grim Guzzler!
2279.howToGet: Unlocked in Blackrock Depths, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2279.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Blackrock Depths, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.

2278.name: Dragon Egg
2278.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, summon a 2/1 Whelp.
2278.flavor: Think of them as bullets for your dragon gun.
2278.howToGet: Unlocked in Blackrock Spire, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2278.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Blackrock Spire, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.

39554.name: Netherspite Historian
39554.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, Discover a Dragon.
39554.flavor: She can tell you all about the history of people not STANDING IN THE GREEN BEAM!
39554.howToGet: Unlocked in the Spire, in One Night in Karazhan.
39554.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Spire, in One Night in Karazhan.

519.name: Freezing Trap
519.text: Secret: When an enemy minion attacks, return it to its owner's hand and it costs (2) more.
519.flavor: "Dang, that's cold." - appropriate response to Freezing Trap, or a mean joke.

2059.name: Arcane Nullifier X-21
2059.text: Taunt Can't be targeted by spells or Hero Powers.
2059.flavor: There was some hard talk between gnome magi and engineers about inventing this mech.

2066.name: Gnomeregan Infantry
2066.flavor: The gnomes are valiant and ready to return to their irradiated, poorly ventilated homeland!

1009.name: Warsong Commander
1009.flavor: The Warsong clan is such drama. It's really not worth it to become a commander.

1008.name: Flametongue Totem
1008.flavor: Totemsmiths like to use the rarest woods for their totems.  There are even rumors of totems made of Ironbark Protectors.

511.name: Upgrade!
511.text: If you have a weapon, give it +1/+1. Otherwise equip a 1/3 weapon.

510.name: Grimscale Oracle
510.flavor: These are the brainy murlocs.  It turns out that doesn’t mean much.

513.name: Mana Tide Totem
513.text: At the end of your turn, draw a card.
513.flavor: It is said that some shaman can say "Floatin' totem" 10 times, fast.

512.name: Frost Elemental
512.flavor: When a Water elemental and an Ice elemental love each other VERY much...

1003.name: Houndmaster
1003.flavor: "Who let the dogs out?" he asks.  It's rhetorical.

38784.name: Infested Tauren
38784.flavor: The Overmind and the Old Gods are surprisingly similar.

517.name: Felguard
517.text: Taunt. Battlecry: Destroy one of your Mana Crystals.
517.flavor: Yes, he'll fight for you.  BUT HE'S NOT GOING TO LIKE IT.

2594.name: Ice Rager
2594.flavor: He's a lot cooler than Magma Rager.

13879.name: Murloc Tinyfin
13879.flavor: High mortality rate, from often being hugged to death.
13879.howToGet: Unlocked in The Ruined City, in the League of Explorers adventure.
13879.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in The Ruined City, in the League of Explorers adventure.

621.name: Ice Barrier
621.text: Secret: When your hero is attacked, gain 8 Armor.
621.flavor: This is Rank 1.  Rank 2 is Chocolate Milk Barrier.

38395.name: Thistle Tea
38395.text: Draw a card. Add 2 extra copies of it to your hand.
38395.flavor: Aren't Thistles prickly?  Why would you drink them? I don't get Rogues.

1221.name: Void Terror
1221.text: Battlecry: Destroy the minions on either side of this minion and gain their Attack and Health.
1221.flavor: If you put this into your deck, you WILL lose the trust of your other minions.

629.name: Lightning Storm
629.text: Deal $2-$3 damage to all enemy minions. Overload: (2)
629.flavor: An umbrella won't be effective, I'm afraid.

453.name: Coldlight Seer
453.flavor: The Coldlight murlocs reside in the darkest pits of the Abyssal Depths.  So no, there's no getting away from murlocs.

2598.name: Kodorider
2598.flavor: Someone called her a Rhinorider, and she's NOT HAPPY.

455.name: Snake Trap
455.text: Secret: When one of your minions is attacked, summon three 1/1 Snakes.
455.flavor: Why did it have to be snakes?

456.name: Captain Greenskin
456.flavor: He was this close to piloting a massive juggernaut into Stormwind Harbor. If it weren't for those pesky kids!

457.name: Blizzard
457.text: Deal $2 damage to all enemy minions and Freeze them.
457.flavor: This spell can be very Entertaining.

38859.name: Beckoner of Evil
38859.howToGet: Unlocked when opening a Whispers of the Old Gods pack.
38859.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked after opening a Whispers of the Old Gods pack.

1988.name: Goblin Auto-Barber
1988.flavor: This guy is excellent at adjusting your haircut and/or height.

179.name: Wisp
179.flavor: If you hit an Eredar Lord with enough Wisps, it will explode.   But why?

178.name: Windspeaker
178.flavor: Is there anything worse than a Windspeaker with halitosis?

38429.name: Twilight Darkmender
38429.text: Battlecry: If your C'Thun has at least 10 Attack, restore 10 Health to your hero.
38429.flavor: First she separates them from the lights, washes them in cold water, and hang-dries.

175.name: Dalaran Mage
175.flavor: You don't see a lot of Dalaran warriors.

172.name: Ice Lance
172.text: Freeze a character. If it was already Frozen, deal $4 damage instead.
172.flavor: The trick is not to break the lance.  Otherwise, you have "Ice Pieces."  Ice Pieces aren't as effective.

38857.name: C'Thun
38857.text: Battlecry: Deal damage equal to this minion's Attack randomly split among all enemies.
38857.flavor: C'Thun's least favorite Hearthstone card: Eye for an Eye.
38857.howToGet: Unlocked when opening a Whispers of the Old Gods pack.
38857.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked after opening a Whispers of the Old Gods pack.

38584.name: Fiery Bat
38584.text: Deathrattle: Deal 1 damage to a random enemy.

2882.name: Pit Snake
2882.text: Destroy any minion damaged by this minion.
2882.flavor: It could be worse.  It could be a Snake Pit.
2882.howToGet: Unlocked in The Ruined City, in the League of Explorers adventure.
2882.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in The Ruined City, in the League of Explorers adventure.

2883.name: Reno Jackson
2883.text: Battlecry: If your deck contains no more than 1 of any card, fully heal your hero.
2883.flavor: Reno is a four-time winner of the 'Best Accessorized Explorer' award.
2883.howToGet: Unlocked in the Temple of Orsis, in the League of Explorers adventure.
2883.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Temple of Orsis, in the League of Explorers adventure.

2053.name: Annoy-o-Tron
2053.flavor: The inventor of the Annoy-o-Tron was immediately expelled from Tinkerschool, Tinkertown, and was eventually exiled from the Eastern Kingdoms altogether.

2881.name: Obsidian Destroyer
2881.text: At the end of your turn, summon a 1/1 Scarab with Taunt.
2881.flavor: No obsidian is safe around the Obsidian Destroyer!
2881.howToGet: Unlocked in the Temple of Orsis, in the League of Explorers adventure.
2881.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Temple of Orsis, in the League of Explorers adventure.

2055.name: Steamwheedle Sniper
2055.text: Your Hero Power can target minions.
2055.flavor: Goblins seldom have the patience for sniping. Most prefer lobbing explosives.

2054.name: Siege Engine
2054.text: Whenever you gain Armor, give this minion +1 Attack.

2884.name: Tomb Pillager
2884.text: Deathrattle: Add a Coin to your hand.
2884.flavor: After the guild broke up, he could no longer raid the tombs.
2884.howToGet: Unlocked in the Hall of Explorers, in the League of Explorers adventure.
2884.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Hall of Explorers, in the League of Explorers adventure.

2056.name: Ogre Ninja
2056.text: Stealth 50% chance to attack the wrong enemy.
2056.flavor: He didn't have the grades to get into ninja school, but his dad pulled some strings.

2715.name: Buccaneer
2715.text: Whenever you equip a weapon, give it +1 Attack.
2715.flavor: The best part of buccaneering is the pants.

2058.name: Madder Bomber
2058.text: Battlecry: Deal 6 damage randomly split between all other characters.

2888.name: Rumbling Elemental
2888.text: After you play a Battlecry minion, deal 2 damage to a random enemy.
2888.howToGet: Unlocked in the Temple of Orsis, in the League of Explorers adventure.
2888.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Temple of Orsis, in the League of Explorers adventure.

2889.name: Keeper of Uldaman
2889.text: Battlecry: Set a minion's Attack and Health to 3.
2889.flavor: U da man!  No, U da man!
2889.howToGet: Unlocked in Uldaman, in the League of Explorers adventure.
2889.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Uldaman, in the League of Explorers adventure.

180.name: Backstab
180.text: Deal $2 damage to an undamaged minion.
180.flavor: It's funny how often yelling "Look over there!" gets your opponent to turn around.

979.name: Demolisher
979.text: At the start of your turn, deal 2 damage to a random enemy.
979.flavor: Laying siege isn't fun for anyone.  It's not even all that effective, now that everyone has a flying mount.

38391.name: Bladed Cultist
38391.flavor: He has a poor understanding of the law of diminishing returns.

654.name: Frothing Berserker
654.text: Whenever a minion takes damage, gain +1 Attack.
654.flavor: He used to work as an accountant before he tried his hand at Berserkering.

186.name: Ancient Brewmaster
186.text: Battlecry: Return a friendly minion from the battlefield to your hand.
186.flavor: Most pandaren say his brew tastes like yak.  But apparently that's a compliment.

189.name: Fire Elemental
189.flavor: He can never take a bath. Ewww.

38488.name: Twin Emperor Vek'lor
38488.text: [x]Taunt Battlecry: If your C'Thun has at least 10 Attack, summon another Emperor.
38488.flavor: Do they make decisions based on age? "I'm two minutes older therefore we burn this village."

658.name: Leper Gnome
658.text: Deathrattle: Deal 2 damage to the enemy hero.
658.flavor: He really just wants to be your friend, but the constant rejection is starting to really get to him.

2623.name: Wrathguard
2623.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, also deal that amount to your hero.
2623.flavor: After playing against 5 Annoy-O-Trons, any normal guard will become a Wrathguard.

2620.name: Elemental Destruction
2620.flavor: I'm not a shaman or anything, but isn't Elemental Destruction the opposite of what they want to do?

2621.name: Wilfred Fizzlebang
2621.text: Cards you draw from your Hero Power cost (0).
2621.flavor:
He can summon anything, even a FEARSOME DOOMGUARD*.

*He's pretty sure this is going to work out.

2627.name: Armored Warhorse
2627.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, gain Charge.
2627.flavor: Yep.  It's a horse... wearing armor... going to war.

2624.name: Fearsome Doomguard
2624.flavor: They were originally called Cuddleguards, but they were not inspiring the proper amount of fear.

1124.name: Wild Growth
1124.flavor: Grow your own mana crystals with this Mana Crystal Growth Kit, only 39.99!

2628.name: Fist of Jaraxxus
2628.text: When you play or discard this, deal $4 damage to a random enemy.

1910.name: Undertaker
1910.text: Whenever you summon a minion with Deathrattle, gain +1 Attack.
1910.flavor: In a world where you can run to a spirit healer and resurrect yourself, Undertakers do pretty light business.
1910.howToGet: Unlocked in The Construct Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1910.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in The Construct Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.

1913.name: Dancing Swords
1913.flavor: They like to dance to reggae.
1913.howToGet: Unlocked in The Military Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1913.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in The Military Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.

1915.name: Baron Rivendare
1915.flavor: There used to be five Horsemen but one of them left because a job opened up in the deadmines and the benefits were better.
1915.howToGet: Unlocked in The Military Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1915.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in The Military Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.

1914.name: Loatheb
1914.text: Battlecry: Enemy spells cost (5) more next turn.
1914.flavor: Loatheb used to be a simple Bog Beast.  This is why we need stricter regulations on mining and agriculture.
1914.howToGet: Unlocked in The Plague Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1914.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in The Plague Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.

1998.name: Ancestor's Call
1998.text: Put a random minion from each player's hand into the battlefield.

38454.name: Forbidden Ritual
38454.text: Spend all your Mana. Summon that many 1/1 Tentacles.
38454.flavor: Actually, C'Thun gives his full support for this ritual.

12.name: Mana Addict
12.text: Whenever you cast a spell, gain +2 Attack this turn.
12.flavor: She’s trying to kick the habit, but still takes some mana whenever she has a stressful day.

38452.name: Darkshire Councilman
38452.text: After you summon a minion, gain +1 Attack.

860.name: Sense Demons
860.text: Put 2 random Demons from your deck into your hand.
860.flavor: Generally demons are pretty obvious and you don’t need a spell to sense them.

38517.name: Nerubian Prophet
38517.text:
At the start of your turn, reduce this card's
Cost by (1).

864.name: Lava Burst
864.flavor: It's like an ocean of liquid magma in your mouth!

2048.name: Druid of the Fang
2048.text: Battlecry: If you have a Beast, transform this minion into a 7/7.
2048.flavor: The Druids of the Fang live in the Wailing Caverns. They wear cool snake shirts and tell snake jokes and say "bro" a lot.

866.name: Shieldbearer
866.flavor: Have you seen the size of the shields in this game??  This is no easy job.

2756.name: King's Defender
2756.text: Battlecry: If you have a minion with Taunt, gain +1 Durability.
2756.flavor: "King's Attacker" is a shield.  Funny, huh?

2757.name: Skycap'n Kragg
2757.text: Charrrrrge Costs (1) less for each friendly Pirate.
2757.flavor: What's more boss than riding a parrot with a jawbone for a shoulderpad while wielding a giant hook-lance-thing and wearing a pirate hat?  NOTHING.

2754.name: Bolster
2754.flavor: The best offense is a good defense.

2027.name: Coghammer
2027.text: Battlecry: Give a random friendly minion Divine Shield and Taunt.
2027.flavor: So you ripped this out of a machine, carved some runes on it, stuck it on a handle, and now it's a weapon of great divine power? Seems legit.

2752.name: Evil Heckler
2752.flavor: To be honest, heckling is not the most effective form of evil.

2753.name: Magnataur Alpha
2753.text:
Also damages the minions next to whomever
he attacks.
2753.flavor: Playing him also gets you into the Magnataur Beta.

2022.name: Ogre Warmaul
2022.text: 50% chance to attack the wrong enemy.
2022.flavor: Simple, misguided, and incredibly dangerous. You know, like most things ogre.

2023.name: Screwjank Clunker
2023.flavor: If it breaks, just kick it a couple of times while yelling "Durn thing!"

38329.name: Infest
38329.text: Give your minions "Deathrattle: Add a random Beast to your hand."
38329.flavor: The best part is the look on their face when you jump out of the cake! Err… corpse.

2028.name: Quartermaster
2028.flavor: His specialty? Dividing things into four pieces.

2029.name: Muster for Battle
2029.text: Summon three 1/1 Silver Hand Recruits. Equip a 1/4 Weapon.
2029.flavor: "I'm bringing the guacamole!" – One of the most successful (yet rare) Silver Hand rallying cries

2758.name: Alexstrasza's Champion
2758.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, gain +1 Attack and Charge.
2758.flavor: "Put more spikes on her.  No, more spikes.  What part of 'more spikes' do you not understand?  MORE SPIKES!" - Alexstrasza

887.name: Master of Disguise
887.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion Stealth until your next turn.
887.flavor: She's actually a male tauren.  People don't call him "Master of Disguise" for nothing.

886.name: Lightspawn
886.text: This minion's Attack is always equal to its Health.
886.flavor: Spawn of the Light? Or Pawn of the Lights?

2617.name: Charged Hammer
2617.flavor: You can only pick it up if you are worthy.

943.name: Blessing of Kings
943.flavor: Given the number of kings who have been assassinated, are you sure you want their blessing?

38738.name: Bloodhoof Brave
38738.flavor: He thought the set was called "Flippers of the Old Cods" and hungrily volunteered to be in it.  He is definitely going to get his hearing checked.

38739.name: Malkorok
38739.flavor: Garrosh's best buddy. It's true. Look it up.

2084.name: Mekgineer Thermaplugg
2084.text: Whenever an enemy minion dies, summon a Leper Gnome.
2084.flavor: He was obsessed with explosives until he discovered knitting. Now he yells, “SWEATERS! MORE SWEATERS!”

39008.name: Master of Evolution
39008.text: Battlecry: Transform a friendly minion into a random one that costs (1) more.
39008.flavor: Will be really useful in the new "Hearthémon" game.

38734.name: Infested Wolf
38734.flavor: A little flea powder will fix that right up.

38863.name: C'Thun's Chosen
38863.text: [x]Divine Shield Battlecry: Give your C'Thun +2/+2 (wherever it is).
38863.flavor: He gave her a promise ring and everything.

39041.name: Cyclopian Horror
39041.text: Taunt. Battlecry: Gain +1 Health for each enemy minion.
39041.flavor: What are the qualifications for being a 'Horror?'  Just how horrible do you have to be?

39046.name: Nat, the Darkfisher
39046.text: At the start of your opponent's turn, they have a 50% chance to draw an extra card.
39046.flavor: You can take away his humanity, but you will never take away his fishing pole.

201.name: Defias Ringleader
201.flavor: He stole the deed to town years ago, so technically the town is his. He just calls people Scrub to be mean.

774.name: Unbound Elemental
774.text: Whenever you play a card with Overload, gain +1/+1.
774.flavor: Unlike bound elementals, Unbound ones really enjoy a night on the town.

777.name: Lord Jaraxxus
777.text: Battlecry: Destroy your hero and replace it with Lord Jaraxxus.
777.flavor: "TRIFLING GNOME! YOUR ARROGANCE WILL BE YOUR UNDOING!!!!"

2875.name: Ethereal Conjurer
2875.flavor: Despite the name, he's a solid conjurer.
2875.howToGet: Unlocked in Uldaman, in the League of Explorers adventure.
2875.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Uldaman, in the League of Explorers adventure.

2874.name: Forgotten Torch
2874.text: Deal $3 damage. Shuffle a 'Roaring Torch' into your deck that deals 6 damage.
2874.flavor: Why does a forgotten torch turn into a roaring torch with no provocation?  It's one of life's many mysteries.
2874.howToGet: Unlocked by starting the League of Explorers adventure.
2874.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after starting the League of Explorers adventure.

2879.name: Curse of Rafaam
2879.text:
Give your opponent a 'Cursed!' card.
While they hold it, they take 2 damage on their turn.
2879.flavor: This is what happens when Rafaam stubs his toe unexpectedly.
2879.howToGet: Unlocked in the Hall of Explorers, in the League of Explorers adventure.
2879.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Hall of Explorers, in the League of Explorers adventure.
