2878.name: Museum Curator
2878.flavor: He is forever cursing the kids who climb on the rails and the evil archeologists who animate the exhibits.
2878.howToGet: Unlocked in the Hall of Explorers, in the League of Explorers adventure.
2878.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Hall of Explorers, in the League of Explorers adventure.

778.name: Harvest Golem
778.flavor: "Overheat threshold exceeded. System failure. Wheat clog in port two. Shutting down."

77.name: Polymorph
77.text: Transform a minion into a 1/1 Sheep.
77.flavor: There was going to be a pun in this flavor text, but it just came out baa-d.

75.name: Brawl
75.text: Destroy all minions except one. (chosen randomly)
75.flavor: Do you know the first rule of Brawl Club?

70.name: Blessing of Might
70.flavor: "As in, you MIGHT want to get out of my way." - Toad Mackle, recently buffed.

38521.name: Faceless Behemoth
38521.flavor: Rejected names: Forty-Foot Faceless, Big ol' No-face, Huge Creature Sans Face, Teddy.

1007.name: Heroic Strike
1007.text: Give your hero +4 Attack this turn.
1007.flavor: Really, if you're a hero, this is every strike.

39119.name: Soggoth the Slitherer
39119.text: Taunt Can't be targeted by spells or Hero Powers.
39119.flavor: Don't tell Soggoth, but in the future he gets totally owned by the Master's Glaive and his skull becomes a tourist attraction.

39118.name: Skeram Cultist
39118.flavor: Just before he comes into play, there is an AWESOME training montage with C'Thun.

1047.name: Tracking
1047.text: Look at the top three cards of your deck. Draw one and discard the others.
1047.flavor: For the person who just cannot decide what card to put into a deck!

834.name: Deathwing
834.text: Battlecry: Destroy all other minions and discard your hand.
834.flavor: Once a noble dragon known as Neltharion, Deathwing lost his mind and shattered Azeroth before finally being defeated.  Daddy issues?

38745.name: Rallying Blade
38745.text: Battlecry: Give +1/+1 to your minions with Divine Shield.
38745.flavor: As far as blades go, this one is pretty great in the motivation department.

2233.name: Clockwork Giant
2233.text: Costs (1) less for each card in your opponent's hand.
2233.flavor: He and Mountain Giant don't get along.

2544.name: Coldarra Drake
2544.text: You can use your Hero Power any number of times.
2544.flavor: The Grand Tournament has a "No dragons allowed" policy, but it's rarely enforced.

2234.name: Wee Spellstopper
2234.text: Adjacent minions can't be targeted by spells or Hero Powers.
2234.flavor: Bane of spellcasters and spelling bees everywhere.

2537.name: Void Crusher
2537.text: Inspire: Destroy a random minion for each player.

1687.name: Core Hound
1687.flavor: You don’t tame a Core Hound. You just train it to eat someone else before it eats you.

1686.name: Boulderfist Ogre
1686.flavor: "ME HAVE GOOD STATS FOR THE COST"

1688.name: Angry Chicken
1688.flavor: There is no beast more frightening (or ridiculous) than a fully enraged chicken.

1142.name: Demonfire
1142.text: Deal $2 damage to a minion. If it’s a friendly Demon, give it +2/+2 instead.
1142.flavor: Demonfire is like regular fire except for IT NEVER STOPS BURNING HELLLPPP

1140.name: Booty Bay Bodyguard
1140.flavor: You can hire him... until someone offers him enough gold to turn on you.

2049.name: Gilblin Stalker
2049.flavor:
"Shhh, I think I hear something."

"Ah, it's probably nothing." - Every Henchman

1147.name: Nat Pagle
1147.text: At the start of your turn, you have a 50% chance to draw an extra card.
1147.flavor: Nat Pagle, Azeroth's premier fisherman!  He invented the Auto-Angler 3000, the Extendo-Pole 3000, and the Lure-o-matic 2099 (still in testing).

1144.name: King Krush
1144.flavor: The best defense against King Krush is to have someone you don’t like standing in front of you.

1789.name: Spectral Knight
1789.text: Can't be targeted by spells or Hero Powers.
1789.flavor: What do Faerie Dragons and Spectral Knights have in common?  They both love pasta!
1789.howToGet: Unlocked in The Military Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1789.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in The Military Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.

667.name: Fan of Knives
667.text: Deal $1 damage to all enemy minions. Draw a card.
667.flavor: I wouldn't say I LOVE knives, but I'm definitely a fan.

1261.name: Savannah Highmane
1261.flavor: In the jungle, the mighty jungle, the lion gets slowly consumed by hyenas.

662.name: Frostbolt
662.text: Deal $3 damage to a character and Freeze it.
662.flavor: It is customary to yell "Chill out!" or "Freeze!" or "Ice ice, baby!" when you play this card.

38528.name: Corrupted Healbot
38528.text: Deathrattle: Restore 8 Health to the enemy hero.
38528.flavor: Not so much "corrupted" as "has terrible aim".

2095.name: Tinker's Sharpsword Oil
2095.text: Give your weapon +3 Attack. Combo: Give a random friendly minion +3 Attack.
2095.flavor: "Get ready to strike oil!" - Super-cheesy battle cry

2094.name: Call Pet
2094.text:
Draw a card.
If it's a Beast, it costs (4) less.

2096.name: Anodized Robo Cub
2096.flavor: It's adorable! AND OH MY GOODNESS WHY IS IT EATING MY FACE

2093.name: Darkbomb
2093.flavor: If you're looking to make an "Emo" deck, this card is perfect!

2013.name: Imp-losion
2013.text: Deal $2-$4 damage to a minion. Summon a 1/1 Imp for each damage dealt.
2013.flavor: The shrapnel is waaaaay worse than the explosion.

692.name: Druid of the Claw
692.flavor: Cat or Bear?  Cat or Bear?!  I just cannot CHOOSE!

39468.name: Purify
39468.text: Silence a friendly minion. Draw a card.
39468.flavor: Even better than a hot shower with vigorous scrubbing!
39468.howToGet: Unlocked in the Menagerie, in One Night in Karazhan.
39468.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Menagerie, in One Night in Karazhan.

2521.name: Pit Fighter
2521.flavor: What did the pits ever do to you?

2520.name: North Sea Kraken
2520.flavor: You have no idea how tired this guy is of being released.

2488.name: Maiden of the Lake
2488.flavor: Not a good basis for a system of government.

525.name: Archmage
525.flavor: You earn the title of Archmage when you can destroy anyone who calls you on it.

2484.name: Lock and Load
2484.text: Each time you cast a spell this turn, add a random Hunter card to your hand.
2484.flavor:
Rexxar narrowed his eyes, grabbed his machine gun, and said: "It's go time.  Lock and load."

This card pays homage to that special moment.

699.name: Tundra Rhino
699.flavor: Tundra rhinos are often mistaken for kodos.  Or am I mistaken?

39465.name: Moat Lurker
39465.flavor: He really enjoys lurking and gets a lot of job satisfaction out of it.
39465.howToGet: Unlocked in the Opera, in One Night in Karazhan.
39465.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Opera, in One Night in Karazhan.

421.name: Assassin's Blade
421.flavor: Guaranteed to have been owned by a real assassin.   Certificate of authenticity included.

546.name: Shield Slam
546.text: Deal 1 damage to a minion for each Armor you have.
546.flavor: "What is a better weapon? The sharp one your enemies expect, or the blunt one they ignore?" - The Art of Warrior, Chapter 9

2249.name: Soot Spewer
2249.flavor: The inventor of the goblin shredder is involved in several patent disputes with the inventor of the soot spewer.

1781.name: Haunted Creeper
1781.howToGet: Unlocked in The Arachnid Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1781.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in The Arachnid Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.

8.name: Mind Control
8.text: Take control of an enemy minion.
8.flavor: Nominated as "Spell Most Likely to Make Your Opponent Punch the Wall."

995.name: Ogre Magi
995.flavor: Training Ogres in the art of spellcasting is a questionable decision.

994.name: Worgen Infiltrator
994.flavor: If you want to stop a worgen from infiltrating, just yell, "No! Bad boy!"

997.name: Bloodsail Corsair
997.text: Battlecry: Remove 1 Durability from your opponent's weapon.
997.flavor: Every pirate uses the same four digits to access Automated Gold Dispensers.  It's called the "Pirate's Code".

990.name: Conceal
990.text: Give your minions Stealth until your next turn.
990.flavor: Rogues conceal everything but their emotions.  You can't get 'em to shut up about feelings.

993.name: Mountain Giant
993.text: Costs (1) less for each other card in your hand.
993.flavor: His mother said that he was just big boned.

766.name: Hex
766.text: Transform a minion into a 0/1 Frog with Taunt.
766.flavor: If you Hex a Murloc... it really isn't much of a change, is it?

999.name: Bloodsail Raider
999.text: Battlecry: Gain Attack equal to the Attack of your weapon.
999.flavor: "I only plunder on days that end in 'y'."

2262.name: Emperor Thaurissan
2262.text: At the end of your turn, reduce the Cost of cards in your hand by (1).
2262.flavor: His second greatest regret is summoning an evil Firelord who enslaved his entire people.
2262.howToGet: Unlocked in Blackrock Depths, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2262.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Blackrock Depths, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.

38456.name: Spreading Madness
38456.text: Deal $9 damage randomly split among ALL characters.
38456.flavor: Most citizens of Darkshire wear those surgical masks to prevent spreading Madness to tourists.

39822.name: Deadly Fork
39822.text: Deathrattle: Add a 3/2 weapon to your hand.
39822.flavor: For a proper setting, place the deadly fork after the salad fork, but before the dinner fork.
39822.howToGet: Unlocked in the Parlor, in One Night in Karazhan.
39822.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Parlor, in One Night in Karazhan.

2260.name: Quick Shot
2260.text:
Deal $3 damage.
If your hand is empty, draw a card.
2260.howToGet: Unlocked in Blackrock Depths, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2260.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Blackrock Depths, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.

38418.name: Cabalist's Tome
38418.text: Add 3 random Mage spells to your hand.
38418.flavor: What's in there? I bet it's cookie recipes!

38413.name: Forbidden Flame
38413.text: Spend all your Mana. Deal that much damage to a minion.
38413.flavor: WARNING: This flame is not to be used unless you are a licensed acolyte of the Old Gods.

1189.name: Silence
1189.flavor: Reserved for enemy spellcasters, evil liches from beyond the grave, and karaoke nights at the Grim Guzzler.

38414.name: Servant of Yogg-Saron
38414.text: Battlecry: Cast a random spell that costs (5) or less (targets chosen randomly).
38414.flavor: Yogg-Saron always likes to complain about how he has too many servants and there are too many mouths to feed.

2068.name: Floating Watcher
2068.text: Whenever your hero takes damage on your turn, gain +2/+2.
2068.flavor: "Evil Eye Watcher of Doom" was the original name, but marketing felt it was a bit too aggressive.

415.name: Youthful Brewmaster
415.text: Battlecry: Return a friendly minion from the battlefield to your hand.
415.flavor: His youthful enthusiasm doesn’t always equal excellence in his brews.   Don’t drink the Mogu Stout!

411.name: Nozdormu
411.text: Players only have 15 seconds to take their turns.
411.flavor: Time to write some flavor text.

413.name: Stormpike Commando
413.flavor: The Stormpike Commandos are demolition experts.  They also bake a mean cupcake.

920.name: Ancient of Lore
920.text: Choose One - Draw a card; or Restore 5 Health.
920.flavor: Go ahead, carve your initials in him.

921.name: Jungle Panther
921.flavor: Stranglethorn is a beautiful place to visit, but you wouldn't want to live there.

35025.name: Cursed Blade
35025.text: Double all damage dealt to your hero.
35025.flavor: The Curse is that you have to listen to "MMMBop" on repeat.
35025.howToGet: Unlocked in the Hall of Explorers, in the League of Explorers adventure.
35025.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Hall of Explorers, in the League of Explorers adventure.

2063.name: Goblin Sapper
2063.text: Has +4 Attack while your opponent has 6 or more cards in hand.
2063.flavor: He’s not such a binge exploder anymore. These days, he only explodes socially.

2796.name: Aviana
2796.flavor: Call her "Tweety".  She'll find it real funny.  I PROMISE.

2065.name: Lil' Exorcist
2065.flavor: Warlocks have the town exorcist on speed dial in case they unleash the wrong demon.

926.name: Imp Master
926.text: At the end of your turn, deal 1 damage to this minion and summon a 1/1 Imp.
926.flavor: She would enjoy the job a lot more if she just could get the imps to QUIT BITING HER.

2067.name: Bomb Lobber
2067.text: Battlecry: Deal 4 damage to a random enemy minion.
2067.flavor: He lobbies Orgrimmar daily on behalf of bombs.

311.name: Gladiator's Longbow
311.flavor: The longbow allows shots to be fired from farther away and is useful for firing on particularly odorous targets.

38279.name: Tentacles for Arms
38279.flavor: That's right. Garrosh just slapped you to death with a tentacle.

315.name: Fireball
315.flavor: This spell is useful for burning things.  If you're looking for spells that toast things, or just warm them a little, you're in the wrong place.

1927.name: Flamecannon
1927.text: Deal $4 damage to a random enemy minion.
1927.flavor: Calling something a flamecannon really doesn't do much to distinguish it from other goblin devices.

1928.name: Snowchugger
1928.text: Freeze any character damaged by this minion.
1928.flavor: Do the slow chant when he waddles by: "Chug! Chug! Chug!"

1929.name: Unstable Portal
1929.text: Add a random minion to your hand. It costs (3) less.
1929.flavor: The denizens of Azeroth have no idea how much work goes into stabilizing portals.  We spend like 30% of GDP on portal upkeep.

2571.name: Spellslinger
2571.text: Battlecry: Add a random spell to each player's hand.
2571.flavor: Does he sling spells, or do his spells linger about.  Who can say?

2513.name: Tuskarr Totemic
2513.flavor: Turns out the tuskarr aren't real choosy about their totems.

38526.name: Psych-o-Tron
38526.flavor: "Annoyinger-o-Tron" was just too unwieldy. And accurate.

836.name: Wrath
836.text: Choose One - Deal $3 damage to a minion; or $1 damage and draw a card.
836.flavor: The talk around the Ratchet Inn is that this card is too good and should be a Legendary.

39269.name: Menagerie Magician
39269.text: Battlecry: Give a random friendly Beast, Dragon, and Murloc +2/+2.
39269.flavor: Just between us, if things get tight the Menagerie Magician position will probably be the first to go.
39269.howToGet: Unlocked in the Menagerie, in One Night in Karazhan.
39269.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Menagerie, in One Night in Karazhan.

2025.name: Seal of Light
2025.text: Restore #4 Health to your hero and gain +2 Attack this turn.
2025.flavor: The walrus of Light restores EIGHT Health.

2026.name: Shielded Minibot
2026.flavor: He chooses to believe what he is programmed to believe!

2765.name: Shado-Pan Rider
2765.flavor: He needed a break after that business in the Vale of Eternal Blossoms. Naturally, he chose to spend his vacation in an icy snowscape killing monsters.

2763.name: Poisoned Blade
2763.text: Your Hero Power gives this weapon +1 Attack instead of replacing it.
2763.flavor: How much more poisoned can a blade get?  The answer is a lot.  A lot more poisoned.

39169.name: Babbling Book
39169.text: Battlecry: Add a random Mage spell to your hand.
39169.flavor: His idol is the Green Hills of Stranglethorn, and he won't shut up about it.
39169.howToGet: Unlocked in the Menagerie, in One Night in Karazhan.
39169.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Menagerie, in One Night in Karazhan.

366.name: Spellbender
366.text: Secret: When an enemy casts a spell on a minion, summon a 1/3 as the new target.
366.flavor: While it's fun to intercept enemy lightning bolts, a spellbender much prefers to intercept opposing Marks of the Wild.  It just feels meaner.  And blood elves... well, they're a little mean.

2020.name: Crush
2020.text: Destroy a minion. If you have a damaged minion, this costs (4) less.
2020.flavor: Using this card on your enemies is one of the best things in life, according to some barbarians.

39160.name: Cat Trick
39160.text: Secret: After your opponent casts a spell, summon a 4/2 Panther with Stealth.
39160.flavor: "I know some new tricks, a lot of good tricks. I will show them to you. Medivh will not mind at all if I do."
39160.howToGet: Unlocked in the Menagerie, in One Night in Karazhan.
39160.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Menagerie, in One Night in Karazhan.

365.name: Shadowstep
365.text: Return a friendly minion to your hand. It costs (2) less.
365.flavor: Rogue dance troops will sometimes Shadowstep away at the end of a performance.  Crowds love it.

363.name: Onyxia
363.text: Battlecry: Summon 1/1 Whelps until your side of the battlefield is full.
363.flavor: Onyxia long manipulated the Stormwind Court by disguising herself as Lady Katrana Prestor.   You would have thought that the giant wings and scales would have been a giveaway.

2021.name: Shieldmaiden
2021.flavor: She has three shieldbearers in her party to supply her with back ups when she gets low on durability.

38569.name: Faceless Shambler
38569.text: Taunt Battlecry: Copy a friendly minion's Attack and Health.
38569.flavor: "What is that thing?!" "I'm not sure, but it seems to be sort of Y'sera shaped."

2760.name: Varian Wrynn
2760.text: Battlecry: Draw 3 cards. Put any minions you drew directly into the battlefield.
2760.flavor: Leader of the Alliance!  Father of Anduin!  Also he likes to play Arena, and he averages 12 wins.

2767.name: Undercity Valiant
2767.flavor: Almost went to play for Stormwind before signing with Undercity.

2933.name: Anubisath Sentinel
2933.flavor: He's actually a 1/1 who picked up the hammer from the last guy.
2933.howToGet: Unlocked in the Temple of Orsis, in the League of Explorers adventure.
2933.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Temple of Orsis, in the League of Explorers adventure.

381.name: Soul of the Forest
381.text: Give your minions "Deathrattle: Summon a 2/2 Treant."

383.name: Light's Justice
383.flavor: Prince Malchezaar was a collector of rare weapons. He'd animate them and have them dance for him.

445.name: Reckless Rocketeer
445.flavor: One Insane Rocketeer.   One Rocket full of Explosives.   Infinite Fun.

389.name: Elven Archer
389.flavor: Don't bother asking her out on a date.  She'll shoot you down.

783.name: Pit Lord
783.flavor: Mannoroth, Magtheridon, and Brutallus may be dead, but it turns out there are a LOT of pit lords.

38666.name: Forbidden Healing
38666.text: Spend all your Mana. Restore twice that much Health.
38666.flavor: No one's quite sure why it's forbidden. And yes, that should make you nervous.

1721.name: Sylvanas Windrunner
1721.text: Deathrattle: Take control of a random enemy minion.
1721.flavor: Sylvanas was turned into the Banshee Queen by Arthas, but he probably should have just killed her because it just pissed her off.

38882.name: Dark Arakkoa
38882.flavor: There's a whole gradient of Arakkoa! This one is on the darker side.

605.name: Ancient Watcher
605.flavor: Why do its eyes seem to follow you as you walk by?

2299.name: Dragon Consort
2299.text: Battlecry: The next Dragon you play costs (2) less.
2299.flavor: Everybody wants someone to snuggle with. Even giant armored scaly draconic beasts of destruction.
2299.howToGet: Unlocked in Blackrock Spire, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2299.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Blackrock Spire, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.

2298.name: Resurrect
2298.text: Summon a random friendly minion that died this game.
2298.flavor: I walked into the dungeon and noticed a slain adventurer. In his final moments, he had scrawled out a message in the dust on the wall beside him. Two words: "rez plz"
2298.howToGet: Unlocked in Blackrock Depths, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2298.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Blackrock Depths, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.

38876.name: Shadowcaster
38876.text: Battlecry: Choose a friendly minion. Add a 1/1 copy to your hand that costs (1).
38876.flavor: I mean, it's not creepy if you ASK before you steal their shadow to make a small replica of them to keep on your shelf.

2292.name: Druid of the Flame
2292.text: Choose One - Transform into a 5/2 minion; or a 2/5 minion.
2292.flavor: Druids who fought too long in Northrend were easily seduced by Ragnaros; a mug of hot chocolate was generally all it took.
2292.howToGet: Unlocked in Molten Core, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2292.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Molten Core, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.

2291.name: Dark Iron Skulker
2291.text: Battlecry: Deal 2 damage to all undamaged enemy minions.
2291.flavor: He loves skulking. He skulks after hours just for the joy of it, but his friends are pretty worried he'll get burnt out.
2291.howToGet: Unlocked in Blackwing Lair, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2291.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Blackwing Lair, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.

570.name: Tinkmaster Overspark
570.text: Battlecry: Transform another random minion into a 5/5 Devilsaur or a 1/1 Squirrel.
570.flavor: Tinkmaster Overspark nearly lost his Tinker's license after the Great Ironforge Squirrel Stampede of '09.

577.name: Bite
577.text: Give your hero +4 Attack this turn and 4 Armor.

2296.name: Revenge
2296.text: Deal $1 damage to all minions. If you have 12 or less Health, deal $3 damage instead.
2296.flavor: This is better than Arcane Explosion, so I guess warriors are finally getting revenge on mages for Mortal Strike being worse than Fireball.
2296.howToGet: Unlocked in Blackwing Lair, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2296.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Blackwing Lair, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.

2295.name: Volcanic Lumberer
2295.text: Taunt Costs (1) less for each minion that died this turn.
2295.flavor: The roots, the roots, the roots is on fire!
2295.howToGet: Unlocked in Blackrock Spire, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2295.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Blackrock Spire, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.

61.name: Spiteful Smith
61.flavor: She'll craft you a sword, but you'll need to bring her 5 Steel Ingots, 3 Motes of Earth, and the scalp of her last customer.

3007.name: Everyfin is Awesome
3007.text:
Give your minions +2/+2.
Costs (1) less for each Murloc you control.
3007.flavor: Everyfin is cool when you're part of a murloc team!
3007.howToGet: Unlocked in The Ruined City, in the League of Explorers adventure.
3007.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in The Ruined City, in the League of Explorers adventure.

606.name: Timber Wolf
606.flavor: Other beasts totally dig hanging out with timber wolves.

3001.name: Explorer's Hat
3001.text: Give a minion +1/+1 and "Deathrattle: Add an Explorer's Hat to your hand."
3001.flavor: Harrison Jones was disappointed that he didn't get to be part of the League of Explorers, but his hat did.
3001.howToGet: Unlocked by starting the League of Explorers adventure.
3001.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after starting the League of Explorers adventure.

67.name: Silverback Patriarch
67.flavor: He likes to act like he's in charge, but the silverback matriarch actually runs things.

68.name: Stranglethorn Tiger
68.flavor: The wonderful thing about tigers is tigers are wonderful things!

69.name: Silver Hand Knight
69.flavor: It's good to be a knight.   Less so to be one's squire.

250.name: Hammer of Wrath
250.flavor: A good paladin has many tools.  Hammer of Wrath, Pliers of Vengeance, Hacksaw of Justice, etc.

257.name: Razorfen Hunter
257.flavor: Someone did mess with Tuskerr once.  ONCE.

254.name: Innervate
254.text: Gain 2 Mana Crystals this turn only.
254.flavor: Some druids still have flashbacks from strangers yelling "Innervate me!!" at them.

2569.name: Twilight Guardian
2569.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, gain +1 Attack and Taunt.
2569.flavor: A result of magical experiments carried out by the Black Dragonflight, it's not his fault that he's a vicious killer.

2568.name: Power Word: Glory
2568.text:
Choose a minion. Whenever it attacks, restore 4 Health to
your hero.
2568.flavor: The promise of glory is a powerful tool to get minions to do your bidding.  Only slightly less powerful than the promise of an ice cream bar!

2563.name: Convert
2563.text: Put a copy of an enemy minion into your hand.

1373.name: Blessing of Wisdom
1373.text: Choose a minion. Whenever it attacks, draw a card.
1373.flavor: Apparently with wisdom comes the knowledge that you should probably be attacking every turn.

2566.name: Shadowfiend
2566.text: Whenever you draw a card, reduce its Cost by (1).
2566.flavor: Hopes to be promoted to "Shadowfriend" someday.

1372.name: Molten Giant
1372.text: Costs (1) less for each damage your hero has taken.
1372.flavor: He gets terrible heartburn.  BECAUSE HE IS FULL OF LAVA.

734.name: Mind Control Tech
734.text: Battlecry: If your opponent has 4 or more minions, take control of one at random.
734.flavor: Mind Control technology is getting better, but that's not saying much.

158.name: Secretkeeper
158.flavor: She promises not to tell anyone about that thing you did last night with that one person.

739.name: Bluegill Warrior
739.flavor: He just wants a hug.   A sloppy... slimy... hug.

505.name: Lightning Bolt
505.flavor: Lightning Bolt! Lightning Bolt! Lightning Bolt!

1037.name: Twilight Drake
1037.text: Battlecry: Gain +1 Health for each card in your hand.
1037.flavor: Twilight drakes feed on Mystical Energy.  And Tacos.

1035.name: Ancient of War
1035.flavor: Young Night Elves love to play "Who can get the Ancient of War to Uproot?"  You lose if you get crushed to death.

631.name: Doomguard
631.flavor: Summoning a doomguard is risky. Someone is going to die.

2585.name: Coliseum Manager
2585.text: Inspire: Return this minion to your hand.
2585.flavor: Meets monthly with the gladiators to discuss career goals.

469.name: Blood Imp
469.text: Stealth. At the end of your turn, give another random friendly minion +1 Health.
469.flavor: Imps are content to hide and viciously taunt everyone nearby.

635.name: Sen'jin Shieldmasta
635.flavor: Sen'jin Villiage is nice, if you like trolls and dust.

636.name: Whirlwind
636.flavor: The way to tell seasoned warriors from novice ones: the novices yell "wheeeee" while whirlwinding.

2580.name: Flame Juggler
2580.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage to a random enemy.
2580.flavor: At first he liked juggling chain saws, but then he thought, "Flames are better!  Because FIRE!"

467.name: Moonfire
467.flavor: "Cast Moonfire, and never stop." - How to Be a Druid, Chapter 5, Section 3

466.name: Arcane Golem
466.text: Battlecry: Give your opponent a Mana Crystal.
466.flavor: Having Arcane golems at home really classes up the place, and as a bonus they are great conversation pieces.

461.name: Sap
461.text: Return an enemy minion to your opponent's hand.

462.name: Eye for an Eye
462.text: Secret: When your hero takes damage, deal that much damage to the enemy hero.
462.flavor: Justice sometimes takes the form of a closed fist into a soft cheek.

1861.name: Stoneskin Gargoyle
1861.text: At the start of your turn, restore this minion to full Health.
1861.howToGet: Unlocked in The Plague Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1861.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in The Plague Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.

1860.name: Webspinner
1860.text: Deathrattle: Add a random Beast card to your hand.
1860.flavor: Spider cocoons are like little piñatas!
1860.howToGet: Unlocked in The Plague Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1860.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in The Plague Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.

38848.name: Blood Warriors
38848.text: Add a copy of each damaged friendly minion to your hand.
38848.flavor: They have an uneasy rivalry with the Blood Paladins.

2014.name: King of Beasts
2014.text: Taunt. Battlecry: Gain +1 Attack for each other Beast you have.
2014.flavor: He never sleeps.  Not even in the mighty jungle.

2042.name: Kezan Mystic
2042.text: Battlecry: Take control of a random enemy Secret.
2042.flavor: They pretend to be wise and enlightened, but they mostly just hate to be left out of a secret.

163.name: Sacrificial Pact
163.text: Destroy a Demon. Restore #5 Health to your hero.
163.flavor: This is the reason that Demons never really become friends with Warlocks.

38655.name: Wisps of the Old Gods
38655.text: Choose One - Summon seven 1/1 Wisps; or Give your minions +2/+2.
38655.flavor: They're just normal wisps, actually. The "Of the Old Gods" bit is just marketing.

2899.name: Sacred Trial
2899.text: Secret: After your opponent has at least 3 minions and plays another, destroy it.
2899.howToGet: Unlocked in the Temple of Orsis, in the League of Explorers adventure.
2899.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Temple of Orsis, in the League of Explorers adventure.

2898.name: Anyfin Can Happen
2898.text: Summon 7 Murlocs that died this game.
2898.flavor: Theme song by Ellie Goldfin and Blagghghlrlrl Harris.
2898.howToGet: Unlocked in The Ruined City, in the League of Explorers adventure.
2898.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in The Ruined City, in the League of Explorers adventure.

962.name: The Beast
962.text: Deathrattle: Summon a 3/3 Finkle Einhorn for your opponent.
962.flavor: He lives in Blackrock Mountain.  He eats Gnomes.  That's pretty much it.

2895.name: Dark Peddler
2895.flavor: I'm offering you a bargain here!  This amazing vacuum cleaner for your soul!
2895.howToGet: Unlocked in the Temple of Orsis, in the League of Explorers adventure.
2895.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Temple of Orsis, in the League of Explorers adventure.

2894.name: Fierce Monkey
2894.howToGet: Unlocked in Uldaman, in the League of Explorers adventure.
2894.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Uldaman, in the League of Explorers adventure.

38669.name: Validated Doomsayer
38669.text: At the start of your turn, set this minion's Attack to 7.
38669.flavor: Really feels good about himself and is in a much better place now. But… he sure does miss piloting those shredders.

2891.name: Unearthed Raptor
2891.text: Battlecry: Choose a friendly minion. Gain a copy of its Deathrattle effect.
2891.flavor: Still hunting for the ones who earthed him.
2891.howToGet: Unlocked in Uldaman, in the League of Explorers adventure.
2891.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Uldaman, in the League of Explorers adventure.

2890.name: Tunnel Trogg
2890.text: Whenever you Overload, gain +1 Attack per locked Mana Crystal.
2890.flavor: Sure, they're ugly, but they live in tunnels.  You try your beauty routine without natural light.
2890.howToGet: Unlocked in Uldaman, in the League of Explorers adventure.
2890.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Uldaman, in the League of Explorers adventure.

2893.name: Dart Trap
2893.text: Secret: After an opposing Hero Power is used, deal $5 damage to a random enemy.
2893.flavor: Five years of tap-dancing lessons are FINALLY going to pay off!
2893.howToGet: Unlocked in The Ruined City, in the League of Explorers adventure.
2893.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in The Ruined City, in the League of Explorers adventure.

2892.name: Desert Camel
2892.text: Battlecry: Put a 1-Cost minion from each deck into the battlefield.
2892.flavor: Dang.  This card is sweet.  Almost as sweet as Dessert Camel.
2892.howToGet: Unlocked in the Hall of Explorers, in the League of Explorers adventure.
2892.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Hall of Explorers, in the League of Explorers adventure.

2518.name: Crowd Favorite
2518.text: Whenever you play a card with Battlecry, gain +1/+1.

2519.name: Eydis Darkbane
2519.text: Whenever you target this minion with a spell, deal 3 damage to a random enemy.

1100.name: Siphon Soul
1100.text: Destroy a minion. Restore #3 Health to your hero.
1100.flavor: You probably should avoid siphoning your own soul.  You might create some kind of weird infinite loop.

2515.name: Warhorse Trainer
2515.text: Your Silver Hand Recruits have +1 Attack.
2515.flavor: He doesn't even get Sundays off.  Every day he's hostling.

587.name: Frost Nova
587.flavor: Hey man, that's cold.  Literally and metaphorically.

2517.name: Garrison Commander
2517.text: You can use your Hero Power twice a turn.
2517.flavor: He'll never admit it, but he pushes you hard because he really cares about you.

2510.name: Grand Crusader
2510.text: Battlecry: Add a random Paladin card to your hand.
2510.flavor: A veteran of a number of crusades, she is a force for light and goodness.  Her latest crusade is against goblin telemarketers.

2511.name: Kvaldir Raider
2511.flavor: Coming soon... to a tuskarr village near you!

1109.name: Injured Blademaster
1109.flavor: He claims it is an old war wound, but we think he just cut himself shaving.

2736.name: Justicar Trueheart
2736.text: Battlecry: Replace your starting Hero Power with a better one.
2736.flavor: It's like putting racing stripes and a giant spoiler on your hero power.

2639.name: Stablemaster
2639.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly Beast Immune this turn.
2639.flavor: Takes way better care of her pets than her brother, Unstablemaster.

2638.name: Powershot
2638.text: Deal $2 damage to a minion and the minions next to it.

2635.name: King's Elekk
2635.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, draw it.

2634.name: Dreadscale
2634.text: At the end of your turn, deal 1 damage to all other minions.
2634.flavor: Let's be clear about this:  ACIDMAW is the sidekick.

2633.name: Acidmaw
2633.text: Whenever another minion takes damage, destroy it.
2633.flavor: With the help of his trusty sidekick Dreadscale, the giant jormungar Acidmaw is ready to face any knight!

2632.name: Dark Bargain
2632.text: Destroy 2 random enemy minions. Discard 2 random cards.
2632.flavor: A prime example of lose-lose negotiating.

2522.name: Captured Jormungar
2522.flavor: You can keep him, but you have to promise to feed him and clean out his tank every day!

13335.name: Raven Idol
13335.text: Choose One - Discover a minion; or Discover a spell.
13335.flavor: Was petrified when it found out it didn't make the cut for Azerothian Idol.
13335.howToGet: Unlocked in the Hall of Explorers, in the League of Explorers adventure.
13335.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Hall of Explorers, in the League of Explorers adventure.

13334.name: Reliquary Seeker
13334.text: Battlecry: If you have 6 other minions, gain +4/+4.
13334.flavor: The Reliquary considers itself the equal of the League of Explorers.  The League of Explorers doesn't.
13334.howToGet: Unlocked in Uldaman, in the League of Explorers adventure.
13334.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Uldaman, in the League of Explorers adventure.

679.name: Divine Favor
679.text: Draw cards until you have as many in hand as your opponent.
679.flavor: This is not just a favor, but a divine one, like helping someone move a couch with a fold out bed!

39207.name: Pantry Spider
39207.flavor: You have to admit, they make a cute couple.
39207.howToGet: Unlocked in the Parlor, in One Night in Karazhan.
39207.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Parlor, in One Night in Karazhan.

1241.name: Starving Buzzard
1241.text: Whenever you summon a Beast, draw a card.
1241.flavor: If you feed him, he loses his whole identity.

1810.name: Anub'ar Ambusher
1810.text: Deathrattle: Return a random friendly minion to your hand.
1810.flavor: Originally he was called "Anub'ar Guy who bounces a guy back to your hand", but it lacked a certain zing.
1810.howToGet: Unlocked in The Arachnid Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1810.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in The Arachnid Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.

38888.name: Cult Apothecary
38888.text: Battlecry: For each enemy minion, restore 2 Health to your hero.

878.name: Dread Corsair
878.text: Taunt. Costs (1) less per Attack of your weapon.
878.flavor: "Yarrrr" is a pirate word that means "Greetings, milord."

877.name: Arcane Shot
877.flavor: Magi conjured arcane arrows to sell to hunters, until hunters learned just enough magic to do it themselves.  The resulting loss of jobs sent Stormwind into a minor recession.

38496.name: N'Zoth, the Corruptor
38496.text: Battlecry: Summon your Deathrattle minions that died this game.
38496.flavor: Has not been able to get "Under the Sea" out of his head for like FIVE THOUSAND YEARS.

1243.name: Unleash the Hounds
1243.text: For each enemy minion, summon a 1/1 Hound with Charge.
1243.flavor: You must read the name of this card out loud each time you play it.

38567.name: Blood of The Ancient One
38567.text:
If you control two of these
at the end of your turn, merge them into 'The Ancient One'.
38567.flavor: Add two cups of Blood of the Ancient One to one cup of lemon juice. Add just a dash of sugar and stir. Delicious!

2037.name: Antique Healbot
2037.flavor: They don't make 'em like they used to! (Because of explosions, mostly.)

2036.name: Burly Rockjaw Trogg
2036.text: Whenever your opponent casts a spell, gain +2 Attack.
2036.flavor: He's burly because he does CrossFit.

2035.name: Stonesplinter Trogg
2035.text: Whenever your opponent casts a spell, gain +1 Attack.
2035.flavor: The only thing worse than smelling troggs is listening to their poetry.

2034.name: Dunemaul Shaman
2034.text: Windfury, Overload: (1) 50% chance to attack the wrong enemy.
2034.flavor: He just closes his eyes and goes for it. Raarararrrarar!

2033.name: Ogre Brute
2033.text: 50% chance to attack the wrong enemy.
2033.flavor: Ogres have really terrible short-term chocolate.

2032.name: Puddlestomper
2032.flavor: He pays homage to Morgl, the great murloc oracle! (Who doesn't??)

2031.name: Bolvar Fordragon
2031.text: Whenever a friendly minion dies while this is in your hand, gain +1 Attack.
2031.flavor: Spoiler alert: Bolvar gets melted and then sits on an ice throne and everyone forgets about him.

2005.name: Whirling Zap-o-matic
2005.flavor: If you pay a little extra, you can get it in "candy-apple red."

9.name: Prophet Velen
9.text: Double the damage and healing of your spells and Hero Power.
9.flavor: He's been exiled from his home, and all his brothers turned evil, but otherwise he doesn't have a lot to complain about.

2748.name: Fjola Lightbane
2748.text: Whenever you target this minion with a spell, gain Divine Shield.

38337.name: Mark of Y'Shaarj
38337.text:
Give a minion +2/+2.
If it's a Beast, draw
a card.
38337.flavor: Y'Shaarj had three sons: Mark, Theodore, and Chris.

2039.name: Lost Tallstrider
2039.flavor: The message, "If found, please return to Mulgore," is tattooed on his rear.

2038.name: Salty Dog
2038.flavor: He's recently recovered from being a "scurvy dog."

890.name: Tirion Fordring
890.flavor: If you haven't heard the Tirion Fordring theme song, it's because it doesn't exist.

891.name: Sunfury Protector
891.flavor: She carries a shield, but only so she can give it to someone she can stand behind.

896.name: Flare
896.text: All minions lose Stealth. Destroy all enemy Secrets. Draw a card.
896.flavor: Not only does it reveal your enemies, but it's also great for parties!

670.name: Nightblade
670.flavor: Your face is the place you'd probably least like a dagger, and where rogues are most likely to deliver them.

38377.name: On the Hunt
38377.flavor: The mastiff giggles if you don't hit any ducks.

436.name: Malygos
436.flavor: Malygos hates it when mortals use magic.  He gets so mad!

38621.name: Klaxxi Amber-Weaver
38621.text: Battlecry: If your C'Thun has at least 10 Attack, gain +5 Health.
38621.flavor: Amberweaving is a specialty course at the local trade school.

437.name: Animal Companion
437.flavor: You could summon Misha, Leokk, or Huffer!  Huffer is more trouble than he's worth.

38262.name: Primal Fusion
38262.text: Give a minion +1/+1 for each of your Totems.
38262.flavor: Golce and Dabbana have a new line of Earth Totems available at vendors everywhere this holiday season.

435.name: Holy Wrath
435.text: Draw a card and deal damage equal to its cost.

39767.name: Medivh's Valet
39767.text: Battlecry: If you control a Secret, deal 3 damage.
39767.flavor: "Magus Medivh sir, I've brought the flaming balloons, as you requested."
39767.howToGet: Unlocked in the Spire, in One Night in Karazhan.
39767.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Spire, in One Night in Karazhan.

352.name: Doomhammer
352.flavor: Orgrim Doomhammer gave this legendary weapon to Thrall.  His name is a total coincidence.

351.name: Master Swordsmith
351.text: At the end of your turn, give another random friendly minion +1 Attack.
351.flavor: He's currently trying to craft a "flail-axe", but all the other swordsmiths say it can't be done.

801.name: Crazed Alchemist
801.text: Battlecry: Swap the Attack and Health of a minion.
801.flavor: "You'll love my new recipe!" he says... especially if you're not happy with your current number of limbs.

38265.name: Eternal Sentinel
38265.flavor: Just try to avoid eye contact.

804.name: Mortal Strike
804.text: Deal $4 damage. If you have 12 or less Health, deal $6 instead.
804.flavor: "If you only use one ability, use Mortal Strike." - The Warrior Code, Line 6

2964.name: Arch-Thief Rafaam
2964.flavor: He's very good at retrieving artifacts.  From other people's museums.
2964.howToGet: Unlocked in the Hall of Explorers, in the League of Explorers adventure.
2964.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Hall of Explorers, in the League of Explorers adventure.

768.name: Gurubashi Berserker
768.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, gain +3 Attack.

2961.name: Wobbling Runts
2961.flavor: The fourth one fell off in a tragic accident.  They don't talk about it.
2961.howToGet: Unlocked in the Hall of Explorers, in the League of Explorers adventure.
2961.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Hall of Explorers, in the League of Explorers adventure.

213.name: Mark of the Wild
213.text: Give a minion Taunt and +2/+2. (+2 Attack/+2 Health)
213.flavor: Not to be confused with Jim of the Wild.

211.name: Sea Giant
211.text: Costs (1) less for each other minion on the battlefield.

762.name: Mad Bomber
762.text: Battlecry: Deal 3 damage randomly split between all other characters.
762.flavor: He's not really all that crazy, he is just not as careful with explosives as he should be.

763.name: Defender of Argus
763.flavor: You wouldn’t think that Argus would need this much defending.  But it does.

1783.name: Mad Scientist
1783.text: Deathrattle: Put a Secret from your deck into the battlefield.
1783.flavor: His mother wanted him to be a mage or a warlock, but noooooooo, he had to go and be a scientist like his father.
1783.howToGet: Unlocked in The Construct Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1783.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in The Construct Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.

1784.name: Shade of Naxxramas
1784.text: Stealth. At the start of your turn, gain +1/+1.
1784.flavor: The Shades of Naxxramas hate the living. They even have a slur they use to refer them: Livers.
1784.howToGet: Unlocked in Frostwyrm Lair, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1784.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Frostwyrm Lair, in the Naxxramas adventure.

767.name: Earth Shock
767.text: Silence a minion, then deal $1 damage to it.
767.flavor: Earth Shock? Shouldn't it be "Azeroth Shock"?

1786.name: Nerubian Egg
1786.flavor: Eggs are a good source of protein and Nerubians.
1786.howToGet: Unlocked in The Arachnid Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1786.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in The Arachnid Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.

765.name: Thrallmar Farseer
765.flavor: He's stationed in the Hellfire Peninsula, but he's hoping for a reassignment closer to Orgrimmar, or really anywhere the ground is less on fire.

38522.name: Eldritch Horror
38522.flavor: Often wonders what path his life might have taken if he wasn't named, you know, "Eldritch Horror".

38943.name: Deathwing, Dragonlord
38943.text: Deathrattle: Put all Dragons from your hand into the battlefield.
38943.flavor: To his credit, Deathwing really took to heart the feedback he was receiving that he needed to be "more of a team player".

2613.name: Draenei Totemcarver
2613.flavor: It's nice to find a real craftsman in this day and age of mass-produced totems.

41.name: Frostwolf Grunt
41.flavor: Grunting is what his father did and his father before that.   It's more than just a job.

2612.name: Healing Wave
2612.text: Restore #7 Health. Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, Restore #14 instead.
2612.flavor: Favored by shaman who study the art of restoration and healing, this spell would feel smug, if it had feelings.

39374.name: Onyx Bishop
39374.text: Battlecry: Summon a friendly minion that died this game.
39374.flavor: B4 is a nice place to visit, but he wouldn't want to live there.
39374.howToGet: Unlocked in the Opera, in One Night in Karazhan.
39374.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Opera, in One Night in Karazhan.

38758.name: Ragnaros, Lightlord
38758.text: At the end of your turn, restore 8 Health to a damaged friendly character.
38758.flavor: What happens when you try and corrupt a corrupted firelord? DOUBLE NEGATIVE, INSECT!

1074.name: Slam
1074.text: Deal $2 damage to a minion. If it survives, draw a card.
1074.flavor: "Dun da dun, dun da dun": if you've heard an ogre sing this, it's too late.

1073.name: Knife Juggler
1073.text: After you summon a minion, deal 1 damage to a random enemy.
1073.flavor: Ambitious Knife Jugglers sometimes graduate to Bomb Jugglers.    They never last long enough to make it onto a card though.

289.name: Wolfrider
289.flavor: Orcish raiders ride wolves because they are well adapted to harsh environments, and because they are soft and cuddly.

281.name: Argent Commander
281.flavor: The Argent Dawn stands vigilant against the Scourge, as well as people who cut in line at coffee shops.

38873.name: Ancient Harbinger
38873.text: At the start of your turn, put a 10-Cost minion from your deck into your hand.
38873.flavor: "honey, can u run down to the store and pick up some 10 cost minions? thx"

282.name: Betrayal
282.text: Force an enemy minion to deal its damage to the minions next to it.
282.flavor: Everyone has a price. Gnomes, for example, can be persuaded by stuffed animals and small amounts of chocolate.

285.name: Cruel Taskmaster
285.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage to a minion and give it +2 Attack.
285.flavor: "I'm going to need you to come in on Sunday." - Cruel Taskmaster

284.name: Novice Engineer
284.flavor: "Half of this class will not graduate… since they'll have been turned to chickens." - Tinkmaster Overspark, teaching Gizmos 101.

287.name: Kidnapper
287.text: Combo: Return a minion to its owner's hand.
287.flavor: He just wants people to see his vacation photos.

286.name: Vaporize
286.text: Secret: When a minion attacks your hero, destroy it.
286.flavor: Rumor has it that Deathwing brought about the Cataclysm after losing a game to this card.  We may never know the truth.

2290.name: Fireguard Destroyer
2290.flavor: Ragnaros interviews hundreds of Fire Elementals for the position of "Destroyer" but very few have what it takes.
2290.howToGet: Unlocked in Blackwing Lair, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2290.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Blackwing Lair, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.

1090.name: Flame Imp
1090.flavor: Imps like being on fire.  They just do.

1158.name: Preparation
1158.text: The next spell you cast this turn costs (3) less.

1092.name: Mortal Coil
1092.text: Deal $1 damage to a minion. If that kills it, draw a card.
1092.flavor: If your spells look like horrifying skulls, let's be honest, you should get to draw some cards.

1093.name: Deadly Shot
1093.flavor: Accuracy is not a highly valued trait among the mok'nathal.  Deadliness is near the top, though.

1155.name: Raging Worgen
1155.flavor: If he's raging now, just wait until he gets nerfed.

39941.name: Barnes
39941.text: Battlecry: Summon a 1/1 copy of a random minion in your deck.
39941.flavor: He used to play every part, until Moroes confiscated his Orb of Deception.
39941.howToGet: Unlocked in the Opera, in One Night in Karazhan.
39941.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Opera, in One Night in Karazhan.

1098.name: Emperor Cobra
1098.text: Destroy any minion damaged by this minion.
1098.flavor: The Sholazar Basin is home to a lot of really horrible things. If you're going to visit, wear bug spray.  And plate armor.

1099.name: Mind Vision
1099.text: Put a copy of a random card in your opponent's hand into your hand.
1099.flavor: I see what you did there.

672.name: Kobold Geomancer
672.flavor: In the old days, Kobolds were the finest candle merchants in the land. Then they got pushed too far...

39476.name: Pompous Thespian
39476.flavor: Alas poor Annoy-o-Tron! A fellow of infinite jest, of most excellent fancy!
39476.howToGet: Unlocked in the Opera, in One Night in Karazhan.
39476.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Opera, in One Night in Karazhan.

39477.name: Nightbane Templar
39477.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, summon two 1/1 Whelps.
39477.flavor: Originally joined to be Arcanagos’ Templar, but has to admit that ordering pizza has become waaaay easier.
39477.howToGet: Unlocked in the Menagerie, in One Night in Karazhan.
39477.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Menagerie, in One Night in Karazhan.

268.name: Cold Blood
268.text: Give a minion +2 Attack. Combo: +4 Attack instead.
268.flavor: "I'm cold blooded, check it and see!"

2499.name: Tournament Attendee
2499.flavor: He was so excited to get season tickets to this year's Grand Tournament.  He normally doesn't get them at first and has to buy them from Ogre scalpers.

2999.name: Excavated Evil
2999.text:
Deal $3 damage to all minions.
Shuffle this card into your opponent's deck.
2999.flavor: MOM! DAD! DON'T TOUCH IT! IT'S EVIL!!!!!!
2999.howToGet: Unlocked in Uldaman, in the League of Explorers adventure.
2999.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Uldaman, in the League of Explorers adventure.

2552.name: Ram Wrangler
2552.text: Battlecry: If you have a Beast, summon a random Beast.
2552.flavor: Not getting trampled is really the trick here.

2012.name: Spider Tank
2012.flavor: "What if we put guns on it?" -Fizzblitz, staring at the spider-transportation-machine

2555.name: Holy Champion
2555.text: Whenever a character is healed, gain +2 Attack.
2555.flavor: She really likes seeing people get better.  That's why she hurts them in the first place.

2556.name: Confessor Paletress
2556.flavor: She sees into your past and makes you face your fears.  Most common fear:  Getting Majordomo out of Sneed's Old Shredder.

2491.name: Mogor's Champion
2491.text: 50% chance to attack the wrong enemy.
2491.flavor: This champion has learned from the best.  Except for his target selection.

2493.name: Master of Ceremonies
2493.text: Battlecry: If you have a minion with Spell Damage, gain +2/+2.

51.name: Windfury
51.flavor: Windfury is like Earthfury and Firefury, but more light and airy.

2497.name: Mukla's Champion
2497.flavor: An elegant gorilla, for a more civilized age.

531.name: Faceless Manipulator
531.text: Battlecry: Choose a minion and become a copy of it.
531.flavor: The Faceless Ones are servants of Yogg-Saron, and they feed on fear. Right now they are feeding on your fear of accidentally disenchanting all your good cards.

2258.name: Volcanic Drake
2258.text: Costs (1) less for each minion that died this turn.
2258.flavor: Volcanic Drakes breathe lava instead of fire. The antacid vendor at Thorium Point does a brisk business with them.
2258.howToGet: Unlocked in Hidden Laboratory, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2258.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Hidden Laboratory, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.

2257.name: Drakonid Crusher
2257.text: Battlecry: If your opponent has 15 or less Health, gain +3/+3.
2257.flavor: Drakonids were created to have all the bad parts of a dragon in the form of a humanoid. But, like, why?
2257.howToGet: Unlocked in Hidden Laboratory, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2257.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Hidden Laboratory, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.

64.name: Swipe
64.text: Deal $4 damage to an enemy and $1 damage to all other enemies.
64.flavor: When a bear rears back and extends his arms, he's about to Swipe!  ... or hug.

538.name: Arathi Weaponsmith
538.flavor: 50% off fist weapons, limited time only!

2727.name: Eadric the Pure
2727.text: Battlecry: Change all enemy minions' Attack to 1.
2727.flavor: Nobody rocks a monocle like Eadric.

2726.name: Mysterious Challenger
2726.text: Battlecry: Put one of each Secret from your deck into the battlefield.
2726.flavor: He may sound surly and antisocial, but he's actually just really shy.

982.name: Corruption
982.text: Choose an enemy minion. At the start of your turn, destroy it.
982.flavor: It starts with stealing a pen from work, and before you know it, BOOM!  Corrupted!

2495.name: Boneguard Lieutenant
2495.flavor: Underneath all that impressive armor, he's just skin and bones.  Okay, maybe just bones.

2073.name: Piloted Sky Golem
2073.flavor: The pinnacle of goblin engineering. Includes an espresso machine and foot massager.

39839.name: Zoobot
39839.text: Battlecry: Give a random friendly Beast, Dragon, and Murloc +1/+1.
39839.flavor: The Murloc is taking the picture.
39839.howToGet: Unlocked in the Menagerie, in One Night in Karazhan.
39839.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Menagerie, in One Night in Karazhan.

985.name: Dire Wolf Alpha
985.flavor: We are pretty excited about the upcoming release of Dire Wolf Beta, just repost this sign for a chance at a key.

38833.name: Twilight Summoner
38833.flavor: If you strike him down, he shall become more powerful than you can possibly imagine.

38832.name: Scaled Nightmare
38832.text: At the start of your turn, double this minion's Attack.
38832.flavor: I like it because it scales.

113.name: Counterspell
113.text: Secret: When your opponent casts a spell, Counter it.
113.flavor: What's the difference between a mage playing with Counterspell and a mage who isn't?  The mage who isn't is getting Pyroblasted in the face.

39426.name: Arcane Giant
39426.text:
[x]Costs (1) less for each spell
you've cast this game.
39426.flavor: Claims to be drawn to Karazhan because of the ley lines. Actually, just loves Moroes’ cooking.
39426.howToGet: Unlocked in the Opera, in One Night in Karazhan.
39426.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Opera, in One Night in Karazhan.

2024.name: Iron Juggernaut
2024.text: Battlecry: Shuffle a Mine into your opponent's deck. When drawn, it explodes for 10 damage.
2024.flavor: The Iron Juggernaut guards Orgrimmar and has just earned the "Employee of the Month" award!

1080.name: Archmage Antonidas
1080.text: Whenever you cast a spell, add a 'Fireball' spell to your hand.
1080.flavor: Antonidas was the Grand Magus of the Kirin Tor, and Jaina's mentor.  This was a big step up from being Grand Magus of Jelly Donuts.

1858.name: Echoing Ooze
1858.text: Battlecry: Summon an exact copy of this minion at the end of the turn.
1858.howToGet: Unlocked in Frostwyrm Lair, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1858.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Frostwyrm Lair, in the Naxxramas adventure.

2786.name: Wildwalker
2786.flavor: She was born to be something.  She is just not quite sure what yet...

2783.name: Druid of the Saber
2783.text: Choose One - Transform to gain Charge; or +1/+1 and Stealth.
2783.flavor: That's saberTEETH, not like curved pirate blades.  That's a different kind of druid.  Druid of the Curved Pirate Blades.

2782.name: Darnassus Aspirant
2782.text: Battlecry: Gain an empty Mana Crystal. Deathrattle: Lose a Mana Crystal.
2782.flavor: She loves mana crystals, she hates mana crystals.   So fickle!

2072.name: Hobgoblin
2072.text: Whenever you play a 1-Attack minion, give it +2/+2.
2072.flavor: Hobgoblins are meeting next week to discuss union benefits.  First on the list: dental plan.

2788.name: Knight of the Wild
2788.text: Whenever you summon a Beast, reduce the Cost of this card by (1).
2788.flavor: He gets a discount on the tournament entry fee because he is his own horse.

39489.name: Avian Watcher
39489.text: Battlecry: If you control a Secret, gain +1/+1 and Taunt.
39489.flavor: He mostly watches light romantic comedies.
39489.howToGet: Unlocked in the Menagerie, in One Night in Karazhan.
39489.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Menagerie, in One Night in Karazhan.

2079.name: Mimiron's Head
2079.text: At the start of your turn, if you have at least 3 Mechs, destroy them all and form V-07-TR-0N.
2079.flavor: Do not push the big red button!

2078.name: Dr. Boom
2078.text: Battlecry: Summon two 1/1 Boom Bots. WARNING: Bots may explode.

919.name: Drain Life
919.text: Deal $2 damage. Restore #2 Health to your hero.
919.flavor: "I've just sucked one year of your life away."

1522.name: Blessed Champion
1522.flavor: This card causes double the trouble AND double the fun.

915.name: Ancient Mage
915.flavor: Sometimes he forgets and just wanders into someone else's game.

420.name: Cairne Bloodhoof
420.flavor: Cairne was killed by Garrosh, so... don't put this guy in a Warrior deck.  It's pretty insensitive.

2071.name: Micro Machine
2071.text: At the start of each turn, gain +1 Attack.
2071.flavor: This card is the real thing.

2070.name: Tinkertown Technician
2070.text: Battlecry: If you have a Mech, gain +1/+1 and add a Spare Part to your hand.
2070.flavor: Won't you take me to... Tinkertown?

2077.name: Mini-Mage
2077.flavor: He is sometimes found hiding in the treasure chest in the Gurubashi Arena.

424.name: Priestess of Elune
424.flavor: If she threatens to "moon" you, it's not what you think.

2075.name: Enhance-o Mechano
2075.text: Battlecry: Give your other minions Windfury, Taunt, or Divine Shield (at random).

912.name: Harrison Jones
912.text: Battlecry: Destroy your opponent's weapon and draw cards equal to its Durability.
912.flavor: “That belongs in the Hall of Explorers!”

308.name: Gnomish Inventor
308.flavor: She's never quite sure what she's making, she just knows it's AWESOME!

38578.name: Shadow Strike
38578.text: Deal $5 damage to an undamaged character.
38578.flavor: It's like a backstab, only from the front. And with two more stabs.

38227.name: Vilefin Inquisitor
38227.text: Battlecry: Your Hero Power becomes 'Summon a 1/1 Murloc.'

2259.name: Light's Champion
2259.flavor: When there's something strange (say, a gibbering demon) in your neighborhood, who are you going to call?

530.name: Captain's Parrot
530.text: Battlecry: Put a random Pirate from your deck into your hand.
530.flavor: Pirates and Parrots go together like Virmen and Carrots.
530.howToGet: Unlocked when you have all the Pirates from the Classic Set.
530.howToGetGold: Unlocked when you have all the Golden Pirates from the Expert Set.

304.name: Arcanite Reaper
304.flavor: No… actually you should fear the Reaper.

9081.name: Ancient Shade
9081.text: Battlecry: Shuffle an 'Ancient Curse' into your deck that deals 7 damage to you when drawn.
9081.flavor: Warning: Do not expose to direct sunlight.
9081.howToGet: Unlocked in the Temple of Orsis, in the League of Explorers adventure.
9081.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Temple of Orsis, in the League of Explorers adventure.

1933.name: Light of the Naaru
1933.text: Restore #3 Health. If the target is still damaged, summon a Lightwarden.
1933.flavor: "Light it up!" - Command given to both Lightwardens and Goblins holding Flamecannons.

1932.name: Cogmaster
1932.text: Has +2 Attack while you have a Mech.
1932.flavor: After a while, you don't see the cogs and sprockets. All you see is a robot, a spider tank, a deathray...

1931.name: Vol'jin
1931.flavor: Vol'jin is a shadow hunter, which is like a shadow priest except more voodoo.

1937.name: Shadowbomber
1937.flavor: Shadowbomber does her job, but she's kind of phoning it in at this point.

1936.name: Shrinkmeister
1936.text: Battlecry: Give a minion -2 Attack this turn.
1936.flavor: After the debacle of the Gnomish World Enlarger, gnomes are wary of size-changing inventions.

1935.name: Velen's Chosen
1935.flavor: Velen wrote a "Lovely Card" for Tyrande with a picture of the Deeprun Tram that said "I Choo-Choo-Choose you!"

1934.name: Goblin Blastmage
1934.text: Battlecry: If you have a Mech, deal 4 damage randomly split among all enemies.
1934.flavor: If you can't find a bomb to throw, just pick up any goblin invention and throw that.

1939.name: Flame Leviathan
1939.text: When you draw this, deal 2 damage to all characters.
1939.flavor: Mimiron likes to take the Flame Leviathan out on some sweet joyrides.

1938.name: Lightbomb
1938.text: Deal damage to each minion equal to its Attack.
1938.flavor: This is what happens when you allow goblins to be priests.

2051.name: Upgraded Repair Bot
2051.flavor: It's the same as the previous generation but they slapped the word "upgraded" on it to sell it for double.

847.name: Truesilver Champion
847.text: Whenever your hero attacks, restore 2 Health to it.
847.flavor: It Slices, it Dices. You can cut a tin can with it. (But you wouldn't want to.)

846.name: Power Overwhelming
846.text: Give a friendly minion +4/+4 until end of turn. Then, it dies. Horribly.
846.flavor: We cannot even describe how horrible the death is.  It's CRAZY bad!  Maybe worse than that.  Just don't do it.

38534.name: Bog Creeper
38534.flavor: He's tried other things, but bog sidling, bog ambling, and bog trundling just aren't as effective as bog creeping.

38532.name: Tentacle of N'Zoth
38532.flavor: Because EVERYDAY is the Day of the Tentacle of N'zoth.

38533.name: Grotesque Dragonhawk
38533.flavor: They say that "grotesque is in the eye of the beholder," but that's just because they've never seen a Grotesque Dragonhawk. Yikes!

841.name: Holy Nova
841.text: Deal $2 damage to all enemies. Restore #2 Health to all friendly characters.
841.flavor: If the Holy Light forsakes you, good luck casting this spell.  Also, you're probably a jerk.

38538.name: Bilefin Tidehunter
38538.flavor: Bile actually makes for surprisingly sturdy fins.

38304.name: Silithid Swarmer
38304.text: Can only attack if your hero attacked this turn.
38304.flavor: If your hero doesn't attack, it's just "Silithid Loner".

38781.name: Twisted Worgen
38781.flavor: Sometimes the Old Gods' corruptions gives you power untold, sometimes you get +1 Attack. We can’t all be winners in the Eldritch lottery.

2050.name: Clockwork Gnome
2050.text: Deathrattle: Add a Spare Part card to your hand.
2050.flavor: Clockwork gnomes are always asking what time it is.

2509.name: Recruiter
2509.text: Inspire: Add a 2/2 Squire to your hand.
2509.flavor: Join the Argent Crusade!  We have attractive tabards and you get to carry really nice swords!

38909.name: Giant Sand Worm
38909.text: Whenever this attacks and kills a minion, it may attack again.
38909.flavor: Banned from every all-you-can-eat buffet on Azeroth.

2923.name: Jungle Moonkin
2923.howToGet: Unlocked in The Ruined City, in the League of Explorers adventure.
2923.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in The Ruined City, in the League of Explorers adventure.

2922.name: Mounted Raptor
2922.howToGet: Unlocked in Uldaman, in the League of Explorers adventure.
2922.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Uldaman, in the League of Explorers adventure.

2925.name: Djinni of Zephyrs
2925.text: After you cast a spell on another friendly minion, cast a copy of it on this one.
2925.flavor: If you want your wish granted, don't rub him the wrong way.
2925.howToGet: Unlocked in the Temple of Orsis, in the League of Explorers adventure.
2925.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Temple of Orsis, in the League of Explorers adventure.

2564.name: Confuse
2564.text: Swap the Attack and Health of all minions.

38922.name: Herald Volazj
38922.text: Battlecry: Summon a 1/1 copy of each of your other minions.
38922.flavor: His whole job is yelling "Yogg-Saron comin'!"

38944.name: Hogger, Doom of Elwynn
38944.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, summon a 2/2 Gnoll with Taunt.
38944.flavor: When C'thun went to sleep, he checked under his bed for Hogger.

38718.name: Mire Keeper
38718.text: [x]Choose One -Summon a 2/2 Slime; or Gain an empty Mana Crystal.
38718.flavor:
"Hey.... Is that Mire for sale?" 
"No.  I'm keeping it."

1986.name: Mal'Ganis
1986.text: Your other Demons have +2/+2. Your hero is Immune.
1986.flavor: Mal'Ganis doesn't like being betrayed, so if you discard him, watch out.

1985.name: Demonheart
1985.text: Deal $5 damage to a minion.  If it's a friendly Demon, give it +5/+5 instead.
1985.flavor: Virtually every member of the pro demon lobby is a warlock. Weird.

1634.name: Young Priestess
1634.text: At the end of your turn, give another random friendly minion +1 Health.
1634.flavor: She can't wait to learn Power Word: Fortitude Rank 2.

1737.name: Ethereal Arcanist
1737.text: If you control a Secret at the end of your turn, gain +2/+2.
1737.flavor: The ethereals are wrapped in cloth to give form to their non-corporeal bodies. Also because it's nice and soft.

1989.name: Cogmaster's Wrench
1989.text: Has +2 Attack while you have a Mech.
1989.flavor: For tightening cogs and smashin' troggs!

2770.name: Burgle
2770.text: Add 2 random class cards to your hand (from your opponent's class).

39026.name: Undercity Huckster
39026.text: Deathrattle: Add a random class card to your hand (from your opponent's class).
39026.flavor: Psst! Wanna buy a random class card (from your opponent's class)?

2052.name: Flying Machine
2052.flavor: To operate, this contraption needs a hula doll on the dashboard. Otherwise it's just a “falling machine.”

2777.name: Tiny Knight of Evil
2777.text: Whenever you discard a card, gain +1/+1.
2777.flavor: "No, no, no. I asked for a tiny JESTER of evil."

753.name: Stormwind Champion
753.flavor: When Deathwing assaulted the capital, this soldier was the only member of his squad to survive. Now he's all bitter and stuff.

1807.name: Dark Cultist
1807.text: Deathrattle: Give a random friendly minion +3 Health.
1807.flavor: The Cult of the Damned has found it's best not to mention their name when recruiting new cultists.
1807.howToGet: Unlocked in The Construct Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1807.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in The Construct Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.

757.name: Argent Squire
757.flavor: "I solemnly swear to uphold the Light, purge the world of darkness, and to eat only burritos." - The Argent Dawn Oath

756.name: Equality
756.text: Change the Health of ALL minions to 1.
756.flavor: We are all special unique snowflakes... with 1 Health.

755.name: Blood Knight
755.text: Battlecry: All minions lose Divine Shield. Gain +3/+3 for each Shield lost.
755.flavor: The Blood Knights get their holy powers from the Sunwell, which you should NOT bathe in.

754.name: Spellbreaker
754.flavor: Spellbreakers can rip enchantments from magic-wielders.  The process is painless and can be performed on an outpatient basis.

759.name: Sunwalker
759.flavor: She doesn’t ACTUALLY walk on the Sun.  It's just a name.  Don’t worry!

736.name: Old Murk-Eye
736.text: Charge. Has +1 Attack for each other Murloc on the battlefield.
736.flavor: He's a legend among murlocs.  "Mrghllghghllghg!", they say.
736.howToGet: Unlocked when you have all the Murlocs from the Classic Set.
736.howToGetGold: Unlocked when you have all the Golden Murlocs from the Expert and Basic Sets.

564.name: Arcane Missiles
564.text: Deal $3 damage randomly split among all enemies.
564.flavor: You'd think you'd be able to control your missiles a little better since you're a powerful mage and all.

2818.name: Gadgetzan Jouster
2818.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, gain +1/+1.
2818.flavor: It's not HER fault you didn't put a spinning saw blade on your horse.

2586.name: Anub'arak
2586.text: Deathrattle: Return this to your hand and summon a 4/4 Nerubian.
2586.flavor: Was actually a pretty nice guy before, you know, the whole Lich King thing.

567.name: Windfury Harpy
567.flavor: Harpies are not pleasant sounding.  That's the nicest I can put it.

39439.name: Ivory Knight
39439.text: [x]Battlecry: Discover a spell. Restore Health to your hero equal to its Cost.
39439.howToGet: Unlocked in the Parlor, in One Night in Karazhan.
39439.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Parlor, in One Night in Karazhan.

2958.name: Summoning Stone
2958.text: Whenever you cast a spell, summon a random minion of the same Cost.
2958.flavor: Sometimes it feels like it's always the same slackers that are waiting for a summon.
2958.howToGet: Unlocked in the Temple of Orsis, in the League of Explorers adventure.
2958.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Temple of Orsis, in the League of Explorers adventure.

38749.name: Divine Strength
38749.flavor: Every year a few paladins get disqualified from the Westfall weight lifting championship for using Divine Strength.

39433.name: Runic Egg
39433.flavor: Oh man! Runic omelettes are the best!
39433.howToGet: Unlocked in the Menagerie, in One Night in Karazhan.
39433.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Menagerie, in One Night in Karazhan.

2951.name: Elise Starseeker
2951.text: Battlecry: Shuffle the 'Map to the Golden Monkey' into your deck.
2951.flavor: A large part of her job entails not mixing up the Map to the Golden Monkey with the Map to Monkey Island.
2951.howToGet: Unlocked in the Hall of Explorers, in the League of Explorers adventure.
2951.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Hall of Explorers, in the League of Explorers adventure.

220.name: Shadow Madness
220.text: Gain control of an enemy minion with 3 or less Attack until end of turn.
220.flavor: You can rationalize it all you want, it's still a mean thing to do.

1026.name: Commanding Shout
1026.text: Your minions can't be reduced below 1 Health this turn. Draw a card.
1026.flavor: "Shout! Shout! Let it all out!" - Advice to warriors-in-training

38475.name: Shifter Zerus
38475.text: Each turn this is in your hand, transform it into a random minion.
38475.flavor: It's like being able to play with THREE angry chickens!

1023.name: Shield Block
1023.flavor: Shields were invented because Face Block is USELESS.

1022.name: Argent Protector
1022.flavor: "I'm not saying you can dodge fireballs.  I'm saying with this shield, you won't have to."

1186.name: Ysera
1186.text: At the end of your turn, add a Dream Card to your hand.
1186.flavor: Ysera rules the Emerald Dream.  Which is some kind of green-mirror-version of the real world, or something?

1029.name: Violet Teacher
1029.text: Whenever you cast a spell, summon a 1/1 Violet Apprentice.
1029.flavor: If you don't pay attention, you may be turned into a pig.  And then you get your name on the board.

503.name: Power of the Wild
503.text: Choose One - Give your minions +1/+1; or Summon a 3/2 Panther.
503.flavor: Never look a panther in the eye.  Or is it 'Always look a panther in the eye'?  Well, it's one of those.

727.name: Hand of Protection
727.flavor: This spell has been renamed so many times, even paladins don’t know what it should be called anymore.

724.name: Southsea Deckhand
724.text: Has Charge while you have a weapon equipped.
724.flavor: Pirates are into this new fad called "Planking".

38318.name: Fandral Staghelm
38318.text: Your Choose One cards have both effects combined.
38318.flavor: Always manages to mention "Back when I was creating the World Tree…" in EVERY conversation. Sheesh! Enough already.

38770.name: DOOM!
38770.text: Destroy all minions. Draw a card for each.
38770.flavor: We ran out of space for "DOOOOOOOOOOOM!!!!!"

38795.name: Doomcaller
38795.text: Battlecry: Give your C'Thun +2/+2 (wherever it is). If it's dead, shuffle it into your deck.
38795.flavor: "Hello, is Doom there? No? Can I leave a message?"

622.name: Stormwind Knight
622.flavor: They're still embarrassed about "The Deathwing Incident".

2572.name: Arcane Blast
2572.text: Deal $2 damage to a minion. This spell gets double bonus from Spell Damage.

151.name: Mark of Nature
151.text: Choose One - Give a minion +4 Attack; or +4 Health and Taunt.
151.flavor: Druids call it the "Mark of Nature."  Everyone else calls it "needing a bath."

2587.name: Beneath the Grounds
2587.text: Shuffle 3 Ambushes into your opponent's deck. When drawn, you summon a 4/4 Nerubian.
2587.flavor: Can you hold these eggs for just a second?  I promise they're not full of giant enraged undead spider things.

38875.name: Forlorn Stalker
38875.text: Battlecry: Give all Deathrattle minions in your hand +1/+1.
38875.flavor: He's going to leave the dying up to you, if that's cool.

1167.name: Aldor Peacekeeper
1167.text: Battlecry: Change an enemy minion's Attack to 1.
1167.flavor: The Aldor hate two things: the Scryers and smooth jazz.

601.name: Keeper of the Grove
601.text: Choose One - Deal 2 damage; or Silence a minion.
601.flavor: These guys just show up and start Keeping your Groves without even asking.

157.name: Lord of the Arena
157.flavor: He used to be a 2100+ rated arena player, but that was years ago and nobody can get him to shut up about it.

602.name: Fen Creeper
602.flavor: He used to be called Bog Beast, but it confused people because he wasn't an actual beast.   Boom, New Name!

9107.name: Eerie Statue
9107.text: Can’t attack unless it’s the only minion in the battlefield.
9107.flavor: Don't blink!  Don't turn your back, don't look away, and DON'T BLINK.
9107.howToGet: Unlocked in the Hall of Explorers, in the League of Explorers adventure.
9107.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Hall of Explorers, in the League of Explorers adventure.

609.name: Faerie Dragon
609.text: Can't be targeted by spells or Hero Powers.
609.flavor: Adorable.  Immune to Magic.  Doesn't pee on the rug.  The perfect pet!

608.name: Shattered Sun Cleric
608.flavor: They always have a spare flask of Sunwell Energy Drink™!

38740.name: Selfless Hero
38740.text: Deathrattle: Give a random friendly minion Divine Shield.
38740.flavor: "Don't worry about me… I'll just be here... under these tentacles."

2057.name: Illuminator
2057.text: If you control a Secret at the end of your turn, restore 4 Health to your hero.
2057.flavor: "LUMOS!" is not what they yell. What do you think this is, Hogwarts?

2002.name: Mech-Bear-Cat
2002.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, add a Spare Part card to your hand.
2002.flavor: Crushes buildings with his BEAR hands.

2581.name: Fencing Coach
2581.text: Battlecry: The next time you use your Hero Power, it costs (2) less.
2581.flavor: Good fencers make good neighbors, right?

48.name: Voidwalker
48.flavor: No relation to "The Voidsteppers", the popular Void-based dance troupe.

2003.name: Malorne
2003.text: Deathrattle: Shuffle this minion into your deck.
2003.flavor: When Malorne isn't mauling hordes of demons, he enjoys attending parties, though he prefers to go stag.

950.name: Hellfire
950.flavor: It's spells like these that make it hard for Warlocks to get decent help.

45.name: Tauren Warrior
45.flavor: Tauren Warrior: Champion of Mulgore, Slayer of Quilboar, Rider of Thunderbluff Elevators.

39442.name: Priest of the Feast
39442.text:
Whenever you cast a spell, restore 3 Health to
your hero.
39442.flavor: Now that's a world champion cheesecake!
39442.howToGet: Unlocked in the Parlor, in One Night in Karazhan.
39442.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Parlor, in One Night in Karazhan.

2001.name: Tree of Life
2001.text: Restore all characters to full Health.

1117.name: SI:7 Agent
1117.flavor: The agents of SI:7 are responsible for Stormwind's covert activities.  Their duties include espionage, assassination, and throwing surprise birthday parties for the royal family.

2507.name: Master Jouster
2507.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, gain Taunt and Divine Shield.
2507.flavor: Needs just a few more ratings points to become Grandmaster Jouster.

476.name: Consecration
476.flavor: Consecrated ground glows with Holy energy.  But it smells a little, too.

2505.name: Argent Watchman
2505.text: Can't attack. Inspire: Can attack as normal this turn.
2505.flavor: Who argent watches the Argent Watchman?

2504.name: Tuskarr Jouster
2504.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, restore 7 Health to your hero.
2504.flavor: Just could not be talked out of using his turtle for the joust...

2503.name: Silver Hand Regent
2503.flavor: The Silver Hand is the best paladin organization.  The Argent Crusaders are super jealous.

2502.name: Injured Kvaldir
2502.flavor: Don't worry.  With a little skin cream he's going to clear right up.

2500.name: Clockwork Knight
2500.flavor: It takes a lot to wind him up.

2648.name: Competitive Spirit
2648.text: Secret: When your turn starts, give your minions +1/+1.
2648.flavor: Competition can be an inspiration to improve oneself.  Or kill all the competitors.

2785.name: Astral Communion
2785.text: Gain 10 Mana Crystals. Discard your hand.
2785.flavor: Hey!  Moon!  Can I have some mana crystals?

2725.name: Icehowl
2725.flavor: This massive yeti just closes his eyes and charges at the nearest target.  The nearest Target is a couple blocks away and has sick deals on skateboards.

2724.name: Gormok the Impaler
2724.text: Battlecry: If you have at least 4 other minions, deal 4 damage.
2724.flavor: Gormok has been giving impaling lessons in a small tent near the tournament grounds.  For only 25g you too could learn the fine art of impaling!

2723.name: Sea Reaver
2723.text: When you draw this, deal 1 damage to your minions.
2723.flavor: A little better than Sea Minus Reaver.

2720.name: Argent Lance
2720.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, +1 Durability.
2720.flavor: The stripes make it look like a candy cane, but we recommend against licking it.

2641.name: Bear Trap
2641.text: Secret: After your hero is attacked, summon a 3/3 Bear with Taunt.
2641.flavor: You'll never guess what's in that conveniently bear-sized, bear-smelling box.

2642.name: Brave Archer
2642.text: Inspire: If your hand is empty, deal 2 damage to the enemy hero.

1361.name: Divine Spirit
1361.flavor: Double the trouble. Double the fun!

2729.name: Bash
2729.flavor: You might think bashing doesn't take a lot of practice.  It doesn't.

38409.name: Twilight Flamecaller
38409.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage to all enemy minions.
38409.flavor: Make sure you summon a Twilight Marshmallowcaller too! Mmmm Mmm Mmm!!

2551.name: Spawn of Shadows
2551.flavor: What did you expect to happen?  He's a Spawn.  Of Shadows.

481.name: Savagery
481.text: Deal damage equal to your hero's Attack to a minion.
481.flavor: It is true that some druids are savage, but others still enjoy a quiet moment and a spot of tea.

2780.name: Savage Combatant
2780.text: Inspire: Give your hero +2 Attack this turn.
2780.flavor: Maybe if you whistle a tune it will soothe him.  Yeah...  Try that.

39210.name: Book Wyrm
39210.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, destroy an enemy minion with 3 or less Attack.
39210.flavor: His favorites are classic tragedies like "The Hobbit" and "Grendel".
39210.howToGet: Unlocked in the Spire, in One Night in Karazhan.
39210.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Spire, in One Night in Karazhan.

1806.name: Voidcaller
1806.text: Deathrattle: Put a random Demon from your hand into the battlefield.
1806.howToGet: Unlocked in The Military Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1806.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in The Military Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.

1805.name: Death's Bite
1805.flavor: "Take a bite outta Death." - McScruff the Deathlord
1805.howToGet: Unlocked in The Construct Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
